title: Mini olive pies by Vaggelio
story:
This is the most delicious savory snack that I have ever tasted!!!

Recipe by louna
ingredients: flour, as much as it takes (about 1/2 kg)

steps.description: Blend the olives in a food processor. Mix them with the onion and the spearmint.
Prepare the dough by placing the liquids in a bowl and adding flour until you have a soft dough that doesn't stick. Set it aside to rest for 15 mninutes.

Roll out the dough in filo sheets that are almost square, then divide the filo sheet into 4 quarters and each quarter into 2 triangles. Starting from the base of the triangly, place a spoonful of filling, then fold the ends inwards and roll towards the top point, like a small croissant.
Place them in a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper and bake at 180°C until golden brown.

title: Seafood Ehomaki (Lucky Fat Sushi Rolls)
story:
Since year after year, my family won't eat store-bought ehomaki, so I make them at home with seafood filling. By serving home-made ehomaki, I can save money, too.

With about 720 to 900 ml of uncooked rice I was able to make 5 sushi rolls with a little bit of leftover sushi rice. Wrapping them with a sushi mat is, of course, OK! My kids and husband don't really like futomaki with dried gourd shavings or denbu (dried fish flakes), so I made ones that they would like. For those using store-bought sushi vinegar, please use 135 ml. For 5 servings. Recipe by Kyoku.
ingredients: 1 Cooked white rice 4 to 5 rice cooker cups (1320 to 1650 grams cooked, using 720 ml to 900 ml uncooked raw rice)
50 grams Shredded egg crepes (or Japanese atsuyaki thick omlette or dashimaki rolled omlette)

steps.description: I use a handy fat sushi roll mold that I bought at a 100 yen shop, but you can also use a sushi mat.  After rinsing the rice, I strain it and let it sit for 30 minutes. Then, I make small cuts on both sides of the konbu, add it to the rice together with sake, and then cook the rice. Next, I mix in the seasoned rice vinegar and cool off the rice with a hand-held fan. Finally, I put a damp cloth over the rice.

The next step is to gather the filling ingredients. Shredded egg crepes, cucumbers, squid, salmon (either cheap smoked salmon or sashimi), and fresh, sashimi grade tuna. This will complete your color palatte of yellow, green, white, orange and red. Aside from the shredded egg crepe, all the ingredients should be cut lengthwise. For adults, use squid or salmon, together with a touch of wasabi.

Wet the inner surface of the mold each time with water. Fill the mold with sushi rice, lay a 1/2 sheet of sushi nori in the center, arrange the fillers inside the nori, taking care to balance the colors, and seal the nori around fillers. Fill the rest of the mold with sushi rice and press the cover on.

Drop the contents onto a sheet of sushi nori and roll to create an instant futomaki fat sushi roll! Even after making 5 rolls, a small bowl of sushi rice is left over. You can use that to make a mini Tekkadon (sushi rice topped with thin-sliced raw tuna sashimi) or Nattodon (sushi rice topped with fermented soy beans).
Cut them to serve. If you want to use less rice, just add more ingredients, if you please.
Since my eldest son loves any kind of sashimi tuna, I fill these with plenty of tuna.

title: Sukiyaki (with Kansai-style Warishita Sauce)
story:
In the Kansai region, we usually don't use warishita sauce, but we add sugar, soy sauce, sake and other seasonings one at a time. It's bothersome so I combined the ingredients together. Not adding water or dashi stock is the Kansai way, I think. I had good feedback on this dish, so I posted the recipe.

Add the warishita little by little as you add the ingredients. If you have leftover warishita, use as seasoning for teriyaki dishes or sesame sauce. Recipe by Gima-ru
ingredients: 500 grams Thinly sliced beef for sukiyaki

steps.description: How to make warishita: In a pot or in the microwave, heat the ● seasonings. If microwaving, microwave for 2 minutes at  500W. Stir well to dissolve the sugar.
Cut or slice the ingredients to preferable bite sizes.

Heat a sukiyaki iron pot and melt the beef fat. After the pan is hot, quickly fry several slices of beef. Add the warishita sauce and let it absorb into the beef. (At this point, take a bite! This first bite is particularly great and you can enjoy the great taste of beef.)
Add vegetables and other ingredients, pour the warishita sauce, and bring to a simmer. Dip in a beaten egg and enjoy!

title: Nostalgic...Ketchup Flavored Udon Noodles
story:
My grandma used to make this for me when I was small. It's stir fried udon noodles (yaki-udon) but for some reason she added a lot of ketchup. I like lots of ketchup in this too!

By putting a lid on and steam-cooking  over low heat, you can draw out the sweetness of the vegetables. 
The flavor differs depending on the amount of udon noodles used and the moisture in the vegetables, so please adjust the amount of ketchup and sauce accordingly. 
Use more ketchup than Worcestershire-type sauce. Recipe by Kinakorin
ingredients: 50 to 100 grams Pork, cut into thin strips

steps.description: Massage the soy sauce into the pork to pre-season it. Chop up the cabbage, and slice the carrot into short rectangular pieces. Slice the leek and bell pepper thinly.

Heat some sesame oil in a frying pan and stir fry the pork over medium heat. When the color of the meat changes, add the leek, bell pepper and carrot and stir once, then add the cabbage on top (don't mix it in). Put a lid on and steam cook over low heat.

After about 5 minutes the cabbage will have wilted and moisture will be coming out of it. Turn the heat up to medium and add the udon noodles. Mix well, add the ketchup and sauce, and it's done Serve with aonori and bonito flakes on top if you like.

title: Simple Poppy-Textured, Tasty Tarako and Carrots
story:
I had this in my o-bento often as a child. It's my mom's style of cooking.
You can eat a bunch of carrots this way.

It's super easy; just cut up the carrots and cook away. Recipe by Erueru286.
ingredients: 1 Tarako (salt-cured pollack or cod roe), large

steps.description: Julienne the carrot. Remove the membrane from the tarako and separate the eggs.
Heat the sesame oil in a small sauce pan, and cook carrots. Add mirin and continue cooking.
When the carrots become tender, (to the desired degree ) add the tarako and continue cooking.
When the tarako changes color, add a bit of soy sauce for added aroma, then it's ready to serve.

title: Basil Chicken Piccata with Grainy Mustard
story:
I used my favorite chicken tenders to create a piccata with basil and grainy mustard.

Adjust the amount of spicy mustard to suit your tastes.
In Step 5, pour the extra egg mixture over the top of the cooking chicken for more volume.
They taste delicious as is, but I like to sprinkle with rock salt. Recipe by naonaos.

steps.description: Remove the sinew from the chicken tenders. Cut with a knife to spread them out to a bigger size. Rub with the ● ingredients.
Grate 1 clove of garlic and divide into 2 portions. Combine the ○ ingredients (for pre-seasoning).
Gently dry off excess moisture from the Step 1 chicken. Spread the chicken with the combined ○ ingredients from Step 2.
Combine the ingredients and combine the ingredients in separate bowls. Coat the chicken with the ingredients and then dip into the ingredients.
Heat olive oil in a frying pan and slowly cook Step 4 on low heat while covered with a lid. Flip them over and cook the same way until browned.

title: Easy Chili Prawn Recipe
story:
I wanted to make a standard family version of prawns in chilli sauce, and after much testing, I settled on this recipe with these amounts.

Don't touch the prawns too much when they are cooking.
Dissolve the katakuriko in the water before adding it to the pan. This will prevent lumps. Recipe by Bakazoku.

steps.description: Put the prawns and starch in a bag and shake it so the prawns are coated. Fry both sides in sesame oil. Fry the ingredients marked ★ off to one side of the pan.
When the prawns have changed colour, add the ingredients marked ☆, mix for 2 minutes and it's done!

title: Grilled Pacific Saury Sushi with Black Rice
story:
Black rice is so beautiful!

If you have fresh fish, just sear the surface. Otherwise, grill it through well.
Use glutinous black rice. It's highly nutritious, chewy, and filling. It looks pretty too. Recipe by pegupepepe. (About 8 sushi, for two)
ingredients: 1 tbsp Sake and 1 sheet of kombu seaweed (5 cm square)

steps.description: Make the sushi rice. Mix about 3 tablespoons of black rice and 1 tablespoon of sake with 180 ml of uncooked white rice. Add konbu seaweed to the rice cooker and set to cook.
Transfer the cooked rice into a large bowl and drizzle the sushi vinegar. Let rest for about 10 seconds to allow the rice to absorb the vinegar (use a sushi rice tub if available).
Mix the rice well with a cutting motion and cool down with a fan at the same time. After it's cooled down, cover with a moistened tea towel on top to keep the rice moist and soft.
The aroma of grilled Pacific saury is irresistible. I like aji (horse mackerel) seared quickly, but I like pacific saury grilled well.
Since the fish will be grilled, it's fine to use leftover fish on sale at the end of the day. Whenever I find special offers, I always buy several to freeze.
Rinse the fish and sprinkle with salt. Leave to stand for a while to get rid of the fishy smell. Salting helps remove the fishy smell.
Rinse the fish gently and pat dry. Let's start grilling.
If you have fresh fish, you could sear the surface with a blow torch.
Otherwise, you can use your grill.
After grilling, slice the flesh on the diagonal and top with the sushi rice to make nigiri sushi. Plate and serve!
I put kabosu citrus, cooked okahijiki, grated daikon radish and shisho seeds next to the sushi.
This sushi rice made with black rice looks beautiful, doesn't it?
Squeeze the kabosu citrus and sprinkle with a little soy sauce. Have a bite!
The sushi rice with black rice changes its colour immediately when mixed in with vinegar. The rice is packed with color as well as flavor.

title: Butter biscuits in 15 minutes
story:
A recipe by Stelios Parliaros.

Recipe by natasoulini

steps.description: Remove the butter from the fridge to get it to room temperature. Place the sugar and the butter in a bowl
And beat them with a hand mixer very well for about 5-10 minutes.
Add the eggs one by one and continue beating.
Add the flour and continue beating at a low speed until you have a mixture that is well incorporated and sticky.
Place the mixture in a pastry bag. Pipe the biscuits in a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper.
Bake at 160°C - 170°C for about 20 minutes or until they are light golden brown.

title: Sweet Potato Kakiage Fritters
story:
We've been making these fritters in our house for many years.

The sweet potatoes cooks through quicker when julienned.
 The oil should be 170℃. Recipe by Yuuyuu0221.
ingredients: 200 ml ★Water (should make 200 ml when mixed with the egg)

steps.description: Julienne the sweet potatoes, soak in water, then drain. Heat the oil.
Lightly combine the ★ ingredients in a bowl, coat the sweet potato in the mixture and fry.
Summer Vegetable Bitter Melon Tempura:  https://cookpad.com/en/recipes/154961-tempura-with-summer-vegetables-and-meat-stuffed-bitter-melon

title: Fried Chicken Breast in Ginger Pork Style
story:
You don't have to use pork all the time for the traditional ginger sauce recipe. Chicken can be a great alternative!

Fry the chicken with the skin side down first and you will have a crispy result. Recipe by Kotori shokudou san.

steps.description: Flatten the chicken breast to a thin slice. Sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of the chicken. Coat all sides of the chicken thinly with katakuriko. Fry the chicken with the skin side down.
Combine the ginger, soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar and water.
Fry both sides of the chicken and add the mixed seasonings. Cook over a low heat. When both sides of the chicken absorbs the flavor it is done.

title: Soutzoukakia with chickpeas
story:
Soutzoukakia are Greek meatballs in tomato sauce. I tried this variation when I had leftover chickpea soup and it was delicious.

Recipe by ΔΑΝΑΗ
ingredients: 1 1/2 cup chickpeas without their skins (either soaked overnight or leftover chickpea soup)

steps.description: Strain the chickpeas, blend the onions in a food processor, add the chickpeas and continue blending. Add the cumin, the salt and the pepper. Mix and then add the egg, the flour, the oil and finely the parsley.
Form small soutzoukakia (a kind of oblong shape, not round), coat in flour and place in the freezer for 30' to allow them to get firm.
Sauté the onion in the oil, add the garlic, the tomatoes, the wine and 1 cup water, salt, pepper, sugar, oregano, cumin and allow the sauce to simmer.
Sauté the soutzoukakia in 1 tbsp oil (I just grilled them for a while) and then add them to the sauce and simmer for 45' adding a little water if necessary.
Good luck.

title: Orange cake
story:
Easy, simple and very tasty.

Recipe by interliza
ingredients: 1 juicy orange, whole, including the peel

steps.description: Place the orange in a food processor (without the seeds, of course) and blend thoroughly.
Beat the oil, eggs, the sugar and the blended orange in a stand mixer.
Add the flour and the baking powder.

Pour the batter in a cake pan that you have already brushed with butter and bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for about 45-50 minutes. After 30 minutes of baking you can test if it is ready pushing the tip of a knife vertically through the cake; if it comes out clean, the cake is baked.

title: Countdown to Christmas 🎄🧑‍🍳 🎁 Advent Calendar
story:
Each day we open to door on our Advent Calendar to reveal a special ingredient for the festive period.  Join in and take part in the fun.  
 ⬆️ ⬆️ Follow this account NOW and you will see what’s behind each door as we count towards Christmas.

#adventcalendar

👍 Never Cooksnapped before? - read about it here: https://cookpad.com/uk/cooksnap_intro

🎄 Get started with inspiration from the community here:
https://cookpad.com/uk/search/christmas

🎁 find out more here: 
https://blog.cookpad.com/uk/whats-in-our-cookpad-advent-calendar/

steps.description: FOLLOW this account, so you can see the challenge in your homepage feed
Each day we will open another door on the advent calendar to reveal a ingredient for you to use in your cooking/baking.
🎁 You can choose to participate on ANY DAY and in ANY ORDER you like during the Advent calendar countdown.
SEARCH for a recipe that contains that ingredient and make any dish you like.
MAKE any recipe (even non-christmas ones) as long as it includes the ingredient in it. Complete as many of the advent calendar ingredients in any order you like.

COOKSNAP: Take a photo of what you made and add it as a cooksnap on the authors original recipe that inspired you. 
Use hashtag #adventcalendar in your description text.
Want to share something you made. You can also share a NEW recipe that other cooks can make and cooksnap. Don't for use hashtag #adventcalendar in your description.
Have fun, take part in the countdown to Christmas with Cookpad and our community of amazing home cooks.

title: Oven Roasted Root Vegetable Soup
story:
“I was inspired to make this soup by the #CookEveryPart challenge and reducing food waste. I had vegetables that were still edible but past their best to eat raw or steamed. Roasting root vegetables slowly deepens the flavour ( and is a no fuss way to make soup). I could not quite use every part - there were some woody tops - but these went into my compost bin for the veg garden,” says Bellhorse, a Cookpad community member in the UK.

Testimonial from Sonia, our community manager in the UK: 

“Root vegetables are easily sourced during all seasons in the UK and particularly in winter. Vegetables like this often go into the food waste when people leave them too long in their fridge or vegetable rack, but they are often easily saved and in fact the flavour improved by cooking them slowly and with love in the oven. Very woody tops and stalks are best left out of the soup, but you can leave the vegetables whole and unpeeled, simply give them a good wash and scrub to remove any dirt. If you tried this recipe, let our friend Bellhorse know by submitting your Cooksnap to her original recipe. It will make her happy! 

https://cookpad.com/uk/recipes/13775204-oven-roasted-root-vegetable-soup

steps.description: Heat oven to 140 degrees centigrade (240 fahrenheit). Wash and chop all ingredients and place in a large ovenproof container.
Add bay leaves and pour over 1.5 litres of vegetable stock (I used 1.5 stock cubes). Cover and put in the oven for 3 hours. If you don’t have a casserole dish with a lid just cover with foil.
After 3 hours remove from the oven and cool.
Remove bay leaves and liquidise in batches. Reheat gently in a saucepan when you are ready to eat. I usually add a spoonful of yoghurt and chopped chives.

title: Corn Cob Tea -- Versatile Natural Remedy
story:
“Do not throw away this beautiful golden hair of corn. Are you aware of the numerous benefits of it? I’ll tell you about some of them:

- Good for urine tract infection and kidney stone
- Good for diabetes
- Controls Hypertension and Cholesterol
- Helps joints inflammation
- Rich in Vitamin C and improves immune system
- Helps skin problems and acne 
- Rich in antioxidant and prevents cancer 
- Good for cold and flu
- Helps losing weight”

...says Nasrin, a Cookpad community member from Iran. #CookEveryPart

Testimonial from Maryam, our community manager from Iran: 

“Hot drinks, made of different herbs, mainly have medical benefits and are vastly common in Iran. Most grandmas are home doctors with lots of natural medical recipes. This has recently attracted the new generation's attention as well, so you’ll find a lot of young people drinking hot tea made of different herbs instead of taking caffeine. Even if they are not sick they prefer natural healthy drinks especially in winter. A good example is this tea made of corn cobs which can be served hot or cold. If you tried this recipe, let our friend Nasrin know by submitting your Cooksnap to her original recipe. It will make her happy! 

https://cookpad.com/ir/%D8%AF%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%88%D8%B1%20%D8%BA%D8%B0%D8%A7/13559676-%D8%AF%D9%85%D9%86%D9%88%D8%B4-%DA%A9%D8%A7%DA%A9%D9%8F%D9%84-%D8%B0%D8%B1%D8%AA”

steps.description: First remove the cob of each corn thoroughly and wash it well.
The cob can be dried and kept for a longer time or used fresh.

Pour the water in a teapot and bring it to boil. When the water starts boiling add the cob and let it boil for 10 minutes. Pass the tea through a strainer into a cup and leave it in the fridge for an hour.
Then it’s ready for drinking
If you are not diabetic you can add some sugar or honey to change the taste. It's a good treat for diabetes without sugar.

title: Lemon Zest Jam
story:
“We use the whole lemon and not a single part of it is thrown away!  The lemon peels can be dried and grinded into powder. Squeeze the pulp and use the juice, and the rest is stored in the fridge for later. You can use them when poaching chicken, for instance. However today, I made a delicious new recipe: a jam made from lemon zest. The flavor is indescribable!” says Hiba, a Cookpad community member from Baalbeck, Lebanon.  #CookEveryPart

Testimonial from Teresa, our community manager in Lebanon: 

“Lemon jam from peels made easy! I think this is the easiest and most creative way to take full advantage of lemons. Nothing is ever thrown away and yet again the outcome is awesome! Who would have thought that the most bitter thing could turn out to be so sweet! 😍  If you tried this recipe, let our friend Hiba know by submitting your Cooksnap to her original recipe. It will make her happy! 

https://cookpad.com/lb/%D9%88%D8%B5%D9%81%D8%A7%D8%AA/13885698-%D9%85%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%89-%D9%82%D8%B4%D9%88%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%B6”

steps.description: Wash the lemons thoroughly, then peel them off in strips. Soak them in water from morning until the evening, changing the water every 2 hours. Keep on adding clean water in order to get rid of the bitterness completely. Sew the lemon peels together with a needle and thread in a spiral form.
Place the lemon strings in a pot and boil with clean water. Remove them afterwards and throw away the water. Add sugar and clean water, and place it on the stove to boil and foam rises to surface.
The jam is left to boil, thus the lemon peels become transparent and the syrup thickens. Leave it to cool down, then remove the threads, and reserve the jam in glass jars.

title: Microwave-Dried Onion Peel Seasoning Powder
story:
“Did you know that onion peels are a rich source of vitamins A, C, E? Not only are they full of antioxidants and flavonoids but also they lower cholesterol as they have a great amount of fibre. Onion peels are always at hand to season different types of stews, broths or sauces. Today we are going to cook the parts of the onion that we usually waste. The amount of onion peels depends on how much you want to cook.” -- Peti, a Cookpad community member from Buenos Aires, Argentina. #CookEveryPart

Testimonial from Sheila, our community manager in Argentina: 

“Peti in Argentina, Stella in Greece, and Becky in Spain joined together in this recipe! That is great! They found out this drying process really works with different types of peels, such as lemons and pomegranates. Cooking creatively means cooking with every part of a product. The onion peel seasoning powder is a very good and cheap product to season any kind of preparation. If you tried this recipe, let our friend Peti know by submitting your Cooksnap to her original recipe. It will make her happy! 

https://cookpad.com/ar/recetas/13769288-cascaras-de-cebolla-deshidratadas-para-sazonar”

steps.description: Wash the onion peels. Drain and dry them with kitchen paper towels. There are two ways to dehydrate the peels. The first one is to put the dry onion peels on a baking dish. Put them in the oven at a low temperature.

The second option is the one I used: microwaving. Peel the onion. We are going to use its peel and the first thick layer. Put the peel on a kitchen paper towel. Put it in the microwave for ten minutes at a very low temperature (30% power).

Cut the thick layer into thin strips. Put them on a kitchen paper towel. Put them in the microwave for twenty minutes at a very low temperature (30% power). After ten minutes, flip the layers. How do you know they are already cooked? They need to be crunchy. If they are not crispy enough, put them on a baking dish in the oven at a medium temperature for 5 minutes.
Let them cool. Put the peels together with the layers in a bowl and grind them. Put the preparation into a plastic bag with hermetic closing or a jar.

title: How To Preserve Lemons And Their Juice
story:
“Lemons are full of antioxidants, proteins, vitamin B and C and they have antibacterial, antiviral and immune properties. However, lemons, as most fruits, are seasonal. As a result, we can’t have throughout the whole year. That’s why when there are plenty of lemons, we store them. In this way, we are going to keep the smell and freshness of lemons for our recipes. In the same way, we can also store oranges. I haven’t tried it with clementines, but I guess it will work as well.” -- Chrysoula, a Cookpad community member from Rhodes, Greece.

#CookEveryPart

Testimonial from Nafsika, our community manager in Greece: 

“Greece is full of lemon trees and lemons are widely used in our traditional daily food and desserts. They are used to create a sour, light taste in our meals and they are perfect for poultry, meat and definitely fried (or other) fish! If we have a sweet tooth, we use them widely to give a fresh, aromatic taste in our syrupy desserts, such as baklava and galaktompoureko, and, of course in our cakes. Welcome to Greece, let us offer you a cold lemonade! If you tried this recipe, let our friend Chrysoula know by submitting your Cooksnap to her original recipe. It will make her happy! 

https://cookpad.com/gr/sintages/11722748-pos-diatiroume-ta-lemonia-kai-ton-xumo-tous”

steps.description: We pick ripe, big lemons without bruises, We clean them very well and wipe them.

Lemon slices in the freezer. Cut the unpeeled lemons into 0.5 cm thick slices, and then cut these slices into two halves. Store them in bags suitable for food, and put them in the freezer. We can use them for tea, beverages, food, and syrup.

Zest in the freezer. Using the thin part of the grater, grate a thin part of the zest. Put it in a small box and store it in the freezer. We can use the zest in cakes, creams and other kinds of desserts.

Lemon juice in the freezer. Squeeze the lemons whose zest we used already. Put the juice in ice cube boxes. When they are freezed, take them out and put them in a food bag. We can use the juice while cooking our meals or whenever we need them.

title: Banana Peel Vegan “Pulled Pork” Burger
story:
“When I read that our next challenge was called #CookEveryPart, I thought the same as you... Should I use potato peels? Would I recycle the meat from the stew? Or maybe orange or lemon peels? ...But I did a little research and I found a news article that says that the banana peel is the meat of the future. I DON'T BELIEVE IT!! ...Well, I mean it. You can't miss out on this vegan ‘pulled pork’ burger recipe!” -- Lara, a Cookpad community member from Madrid, Spain.

Testimonial from Irene, our community manager in Spain: 

“A great example of how to make incredible dishes with existing ingredients that are always sitting in your fridge! You don't need to be vegan to try this amazing ‘burger’. But I have to warn you that this burger will become your favorite. If you tried this recipe, let our friend Lara know by submitting your Cooksnap to her original recipe. It will make her happy! 

https://cookpad.com/es/recetas/13757454-pulled-pork-o-no-%F0%9F%98%8B-vegan”
ingredients: 1 teaspoon powdered smoke or liquid smoke
6 tablespoons BBQ sauce (You can put more if you want)
If you are not vegan or vegetarian you can use classic cheese and bacon

steps.description: Put the banana peels to cook with water and salt. The more mature the banana, the less cooking time between 5 and 10 minutes.
Drain the banana peels when they are soft, let them rest for about 3 minutes and tear them into strips with a fork or a knife.
In a bowl, put the banana strips, the soy sauce and the spice mixture. Stir with your hands or a spatula, and let it rest for about 10 minutes.
Put a little oil in a pan. Fry the onion until it becomes transparent, and add the banana strips and the 4 tablespoons of BBQ sauce.
Let it cook for about 10 minutes over low heat and stir so that it does not stick. You can add more BBQ sauce and coriander, if you like. Remove the pan from heat and let it rest.
Toast the bread buns, and put the sauces. Cook our vegan bacon until it is toasted.
Put the banana peels, cheese, bacon and raw onion.
Serve it with potatoes or fried sweet potatoes, and enjoy this new and delicious ingredient!

title: Kid-approved! Sweet Orange Peel Gummy & Syrup
story:
“Make a snack and a syrup altogether 😍 To #CookEveryPart, this time I made orange peel gummy and syrup from the same set of ingredients. Yummy… This is like any other candied orange peels. The difference is that my recipe assures a smooth taste and no bitterness at all. Perfect for snacking while you are reading a book or watching a Korean drama... this is so great 😍😁” -- Phie, a Cookpad community member from Jakarta, Indonesia.

Testimonial from Aprina, our community manager in Indonesia: 

“Another unique way to consume your orange entirely. This recipe does not shake off the freshness of the orange itself so you can still get the orange as fruit and process the orange peel becoming a new cooking creation. Natural yet sweet and safe to be consumed for children -- at a normal level, of course 😉. If you tried this recipe, let our friend Phie know by submitting your Cooksnap to her original recipe. It will make her happy!

You can find her original recipe here: https://cookpad.com/id/resep/13692285-orange-gummy-syrup

steps.description: Wash the oranges. Coat them with baking soda, then soak them for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, rinse the oranges then clean them.

Cut the peel of each orange into 4 or 5 pieces so that it will be easier to cut off later. Peel the entire orange peel. Next, boil water, then add orange peels. Allow the orange peels to boil for about eight minutes then drain. Put them in cold water.

Boil water, bring the orange peels to a boil then leave it for 10 minutes. After that, put them again in cold water. Remove the white pith from the peel with a knife, so that the orange peels won’t taste bitter.
Drain the orange peels, then cut them vertically
Boil sugar and water, stir until both of the ingredients mixed well. Add the orange peels and let it boil for a while as you stir. Reduce the heat, and cook for 45 minutes.

Drain the peels in a colander. Put them on a baking sheet, make sure there are gaps between each peel, so they don’t stack. Heat them in 40 Celcius for 1 hour, or just let them in a room temperature for 24 hours. After they are all dried, coat them with sugar. Put the boiled water in a container. The syrup could be used for anything. For instance, mix the 3 tbsp of simple syrup with milk and ice cubes.
Voila, It’s ready!

title: Mini olive pies
story:
Fluffy, tasty eliopitakia (mini olive pies), and of course, if you don't brush them with egg yolk, vegan.

Recipe by Phoebe
ingredients: 3 cups black olives (pitted and cut into small pieces)

steps.description: Mix all the ingredients for the filling in a bowl.

Using another bowl, place the flour with the baking powder, the salt and the sugar, mix and then make a well in the middle and pour in the oil. Work the mixture with your hands so that the flour absorbs all the oil and you have a crumbly dough. Then add as much orange juice as it takes to have a soft and fluffy dough (I always use all of the orange juice).
Roll out a thin filo sheet, cut oblong pieces (depending how big you want them to be) place a tbsp of the filling in each and roll them into a roll.
Place the mini olive pies in a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper and after you brush them with egg yolk, sprinkle sesame seeds on top.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180oC for 30-40 minutes or until you see that they are golden brown.

title: Vegan Vegetable Jus
story:
As part of #cookeverypart challenge we love this vegan vegetable Jus recipe from Jena, a home cook in our Germany Cookpad community.  The delicious jus uses the whole vegetable. 🥕🌿.  And can be made in batch and portioned and frozen for later.

Do you have a recipe inspired by #cookeverypart? If you want to join in the challenge? Check out all our challenge pages here and add your recipes today.
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6705-week-1-flavour-explorer
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6753-week-2-fridge-forager
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6800-week-3-waste-warrior

You can also find this recipe here: https://cookpad.com/de/rezepte/13906499-vegane-jus
ingredients: 2 bunches soup vegetables (carrots, parsley, cellery root, leeks)

steps.description: Wash the vegetables, but do not peel them. Cut into finger-thick pieces. Crush the juniper berries.
Sauté the vegetables and herbs vigorously in oil on all sides. This takes about 15 to 20 minutes.
Add the tomato purée and fry briefly, but do not let it turn black.

Pour in 300 ml of juice and boil down until slightly bubbly.
Repeat until the first bottle is empty.
Pour in the second bottle and simmer until about ¼ of the liquid is gone. Then transfer through a sieve into another pot. Drain the vegetables well.
Heat the stock in the new pot and add vegetable stock. Simmer for another 1 to 2 hours.

title: Croutons
story:
We loved this recipe from our Global Cookpad Community and wanted to showcase the versatility of bread as part of #cookeverypart #wastewarrior challenge. 

This crunchy, garlicky crouton recipe looks delicious from homecook 'A-Bomb' in our American community.

Do you have a recipe that uses bread? If you want to join in the challenge? Check out all our #cookeverypart challenge pages here and add your recipes today.
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6800-week-3-waste-warrior
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6705-week-1-flavour-explorer
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6753-week-2-fridge-forager

You can also find this recipe here:
https://cookpad.com/us/recipes/15625563-croutons

steps.description: Preheat oven to 300°F (148C)
Using a serrated knife, cut bread into bite-sized squares

Use a baking sheet covered in aluminum foil and place in oven. Bake for ten minutes at a time. Pull out every ten minutes to rearrange bread pieces to ensure an even toast. Bake until golden and crunchy (approximately one hour)
Allow toasted bread pieces to cool at room temperature.
Cut butter into small squares
Microwave butter until it is partially melted (approximately 30 seconds)
Whip butter into a pasty consistency.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Add toasted bread pieces to buttery mixture and toss until every piece is evenly coated. (Discard any crumbs that are on the baking sheet, do not add this into the mix)
Place the coated bread pieces back onto the baking sheet and put it back into the oven.
Bake approximately 16 minutes until the buttery mix has soaked into the bread and dried out. (Check about every 4 minutes to rearrange the pieces to ensure an even bake)
Remove from oven and allow croutons to cool on baking sheet.
Transfer to a zip lock bag and enjoy with your next salad!

title: Celery Pesto
story:
Another great recipe from the Cookpad global community.  Today we found this delicious pesto recipe from Stefan in our Germany Community.  Stefan says, "Pesto and pasta are always a good combination. But why always use classic genovese (i.e. basil)? Pesto can be made from almost anything. However, you can also enjoy the celery pesto on bread."

Do you have a recipe that uses alternative ingredients? If you want to join in the challenge? Check out all our #cookeverypart challenge pages here and add your recipes today.

https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6800-week-3-waste-warrior

You can also find this recipe here:https://cookpad.com/de/rezepte/14043531-sellerie-pesto
ingredients: 100 g nuts (pine nuts, sunflower seeds, walnuts)

steps.description: Clean and coarsely chop the celery.
Puree all the ingredients into a nice mixture.
Just put a few spoonfuls on the pasta of your choice and enjoy. Put the rest in a jar and cover with oil, then it will keep well.

title: Semmelknödel / Bread dumplings
story:
Bread is one of the most wasted ingredients in the UK home.  For the third week of #cookeverypart #wastewarrior challenge we love this recipe from Nessi in the German Cookpad community made this delcious bread dumplings.
Nessi says, "For this recipe, I always collect leftover bread, pretzels and rolls in a bowl until there are enough for a new round of dumplings. Just cut the leftover bread into cubes, let them dry well and then collect them. The bread dumplings are great for freezing. Just let them cool down after cooking and wrap them up well and put them in the freezer. If you want to use the frozen bread dumplings, defrost them and then cook them only until they are warm, i.e. as briefly as possible, so that they do not soak up the cooking water.

Do you have a recipe that uses bread? If you want to join in the challenge? Check out all our #cookeverypart challenge pages here and add your recipes today. 
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6800-week-3-waste-warrior
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6705-week-1-flavour-explorer
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6753-week-2-fridge-forager

You can also find this recipe here: https://cookpad.com/de/rezepte/15114985-semmelknodel
ingredients: Stock or salted water to boil

steps.description: Heat the milk and mix with the bread pieces. Mix well. Leave the mixture to stand for about 30 minutes.
Add salt, pepper, nutmeg and herbs and mix in.
Beat the eggs and add to the mixture. Mix well.
Dice the onion and sauté in butter. They should not brown. Then add to the mixture and mix well.

Form dumplings with your hands. I wet my hands for this so that I can make a kind of wet "seal" on the outside. If they cannot be formed because there is too much liquid, even them out with breadcrumbs.

Boil / steep the dumplings in stock or salted water. Do not boil too much at the beginning, otherwise the movement in the water can break the dumplings apart.
Simmer the dumplings for about 20 minutes, moving them a little at a time so that they are submerged on each side.

When the time is up, carefully remove the dumplings from the pot with a slotted spoon.
Now either enjoy or leave to cool and freeze.

title: Chili Con Carne-style Vegetable Salad
story:
By using raw vegetables, you can make a raw food-style salad. Serve with great with corn bread. Recipe by conamonn.
recipe written on 10/12/2014
ingredients: If It's Too Much, Make 1/2 Or 1/4 of a Batch
to taste green peppers, red peppers, corn kernals
to taste sweet chili sauce, mexican dressing, green tabasco sauce

steps.description: Combine the chili seasoning, (salt), and canned tomatoes.
Mix in the cut peppers and thawed corn kernels.
Top with sweet chili sauce and enjoy.
If you simmer it, it will become a vegetable chili con carne.

title: Oil-free Baked Savory Donuts
story:
These baked donuts are lighter than ones that contain butter and smell great too. Try slicing them in half like bagels and sandwich raw veggies. They have an unusual texture that goes so well with the veggies. Recipe by conamonn.
recipe written on 10/12/2014
ingredients: 60 grams honey (acacia, etc) for moist donuts
60 grams milk (don't use soy milk, they'll become dense) Fillings, Toppings Etc.
to taste cheese (easy melting type, sliced or whatever you'd like, or even vegetarian cheese)
to taste meat (ham, sausage, bacon etc), fish (salted salmon, shirasu etc.)
to taste vegetables (canned corn, cooked vegetables, etc), herbs (dried parsley, etc.) - the donuts will become doughy don't add too many vegetables

steps.description: Mix the batter ingredients together.
Fill the donut molds evenly with cheese, vegetables, meat etc. Pour the batter in over them.
Don't mix the vegetables etc. into the batter, or the batter will get too watery.
Bake at 180°C for 15 minutes. Don't overbake these! Bake for a shorter time than regular baked donuts. Adjust the time depending on your oven.
You can adjust the consistency of the batter with milk (or water). I've listed an average amount in the recipe, so if there are any issues please try adding more or less milk or water.
Don't mix grated cheese into the batter - the donuts will become hard. It's best to sprinkle cheese into the bottom of the donut molds.
The honey is indispensable for the texture of the batter. Don't reduce it too much.
Slice the donuts in half and make raw vegetable sandwiches. The crispy texture is irresistible ♪ Apparently shops that sell cake salé (savory cakes) use their leftover cakes for vegetable sandwiches.

title: Persimmon and Sweet Potato Salad Spiced with Wasabi
story:
Wasabi combined with persimmons and sweet potatoes. Seems like an unlikely combination, but it's oh-so-delicious. Recipe by Hakka pan
recipe written on 10/12/2014

steps.description: Combine the ☆ ingredients. Combine the wasabi with honey first, add lemon juice and salt, then finally the oil to emulsify.
Cut the cucumbers lengthwise into half, then into diagonal slices. Mince the onions. Combine in a bowl, rub with a pinch of salt (not listed), and let rest.
Slice the potatoes 1 cm thick and soak in water for 5 minutes. Toss in the frying pan, avoiding the pieces from overlapping each other. Add water.

Turn on the heat and once it comes to a boil, bring down the heat to the lowest, cover with a lid, and steam until the potatoes soften. Remove the lid once the potatoes are soft enough and evaporate any leftover water.
While the potatoes are still hot, mash roughly and combine with the ingredients from Step 1. Mash to your desired consistency. I like leaving chunks.
Remove the leaves of the persimmon and dice into 1 cm.
Once the potatoes have cooled, combine the tightly squeezed cucumbers and onions, persimmons, and toss.

title: Dry-Roasted Soy Beans Pickled in Balsamic Vinegar
story:
Just dry-roast some dried soy beans, and put them in a pickling liquid made with balsamic vinegar. These beans are spicy, sweet, and sour, and are very chewy, too. Recipe by Hakka pan
recipe written on 10/12/2014

steps.description: Put the ☆ ingredients in a pan and heat it up. Turn off the heat once it comes to a boil. (This is the pickling liquid.)
Rinse the dried soy beans quickly, and dry roast them in a frying pan (over low-medium heat). When the skins split open and you can bite through them easily, they're done!
Put the red-hot beans in the pickling liquid. The beans will start soaking up the liquid right away. Let the beans cool down while mixing occasionally.
In 20 to 30 minutes it should look like this. The soy beans should swell from soaking up the liquid. You can eat them at this stage, but they are even better after they're pickled overnight.
The little seeds are mustard.
I used this pickling spice mix from GABAN. This is a whole spice mix, but you can also use a powdered mix.
Even if you don't have any pickling spice mix, you can combine your favorite spices.
If you are using this GABAN mix, the cloves are really hard, so take them out before serving the soy beans.
Spices that are suitable for pickles include cinnamon, bay leaves, mustard seeds, allspice, and cayenne pepper.
...and dill seeds, too.

title: Oven baked penne with cottage cheese and "habijabi" leftovers
story:
Being a #cookeverypart #fridgeforager is all about using your #leftovers to create delicious meals from the parts that otherwise go under-utilised.  Making cooking fun and imaginative using leftovers allows home cooks everywhere to be resourceful and  playful with their food.  💪💪💪
We found this yummy recipe in our Bangladesh Cookpad Community from Rezwan Islam and can't wait to try it ourselves.

🥘 Rezwan says this recipe came from "leftover cabbage from lunch, pepper skin saved from making Ajvar (a a condiment made principally from sweet bell peppers and eggplants) and some leftover cheese."  Great job Rezwan, we hope their creativity in the kitchen inspires you to create with your leftovers this week.

Do you have a recipe that uses leftovers? If you want to join in the challenge? Check out our challenge pages here and add your recipes today. https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6705-week-1-flavour-explorer
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6753-week-2-fridge-forager

You can also find this recipe here: https://cookpad.com/bd/recipes/15588351-oven-baked-penne-with-cottage-cheese-and-habijabi-leftovers
ingredients: 1 small block of Trappist cheese 🧀 (or Edam cheese)

steps.description: Cook your pasta carefully till al dente 😬
Gather all your leftovers, olives, peas and mix it well with the cottage cheese. Add the olive oil and salt and pepper too.

Add the pasta and mix it well but softly so that the penne don't get smashed. Spread around the leftover cheese on the top.

(NB: If you can't find Trappist cheese then a great substitute is Dutch Edam cheese or American Monterey Jack Cheese)

Bake in a 200°c preheated oven but only heat from the top. Bake it for 20 minutes until you get the top a bit brown...
Enjoy you meal!

title: Cauliflower Stem Nutmeg Soup
story:
Another fantastic recipe from our global Cookpad community for the #cookeverypart challenge. 💪 This cauliflower recipe from our United States community by the Hobby Horseman is easy to make, utilises parts of the cauliflower otherwise discarded and looks delicious.  
Home cook, Hobby Horseman says, "We try to use everything we grow, and the stems of cauliflower contain the most intense flavour, perfect for making a creamy soup, with a dash of nutmeg. I make a cheese sauce for the cauliflower florets for dinner and the nutmeg makes the cream soup taste distinct from the cheesy cauliflower."
🥣🥣🥣🥣🥣🥣
Do you have a recipe that uses parts otherwise thrown away or can make dishes using leftovers?? Don't miss out!! If you want to join in? Check out our challenge pages here and add your recipes today. https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6705-week-1-flavour-explorer
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6753-week-2-fridge-forager

You can also find this recipe here: https://cookpad.com/us/recipes/15582386-california-farm-cauliflower-stem-nutmeg-soup
ingredients: 4 cups cauliflower stems (sliced as carrot slices)

steps.description:
Quarter cauliflower top to bottom, cut florets off and set aside, trim and wash stem and outer leaves, cut in thin carrot slices. A two pound cauliflower will have one pound of stem and one pound of florets. 
In closed pan, steam cut up pieces of cauliflower stem in two cups of water, pinch of salt, for 20 minutes, reduce to simmer, add water to replace steamed off water, and mash with potato masher till creamed.
Add cup of milk, stir, keep soup warm, never boiling.

Whip egg yolk in heavy cream in large measuring cup till smooth, add cup of soup broth, mix till smooth, drizzle mixture slowly into soup while stirring. Add pepper to taste. Serve in bowls, sprinkling fresh ground nutmeg on top. Enjoy

title: Cinnamon & Sugar Baked Apple Peel Chips
story:
Our #cookeverypart challenges running throughout October are showcasing recipes that celebrate conscience cooking. 🧑‍🍳 Whether you #fridgeforage  to use up your leftovers or you are a #flavourexplorer using parts of your veg and meat that aren't often utilised, such as peels, greenery or off cuts, there is something for everyone.
🍗🥕🧅🥦
We love this recipe from our global Cookpad community in the United States by Chef Mommy Nessa.🧑‍🍳 
Nessa says, "you can make this with any amount of peels that you want/have. This recipe was made during one of my hardcore "zero waste" phases. We have a large family and many mouths to feed so I'm always trying to use every part of foods that I can and also it's good for the earth to waste less! Peeling apples one day and I thought to myself WHY waste these!? And my picky eater kids that made me peel the apples in the first place 🙄 because they don't want to eat the skin,... Loved These! 🤦🏻‍♀️😁👌😏👏 What kid doesn't like "chips," am I right!?"
🍎🍏🍎🍏🍎🍏🍎🍏
Don't miss out!! If you want to join in? Check out our challenge pages here and add your recipe today. https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6705-week-1-flavour-explorer
https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6753-week-2-fridge-forager

You can also find this recipe here:
https://cookpad.com/us/recipes/11617839-cinnamon-sugar-baked-apple-peel-chips
ingredients: 4 cups fresh apple peels (about 1 bag of small apples)

steps.description: Preheat oven to 107°C (225°F). Toss apple peels and coat with lemon juice and desired amounts of sugar and cinnamon
Place apple peels flat across a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 2 hours or until peels are desired level crispness. Enjoy!

title: Chicken with vegetables in a casserole dish
story:
An extremely delicious and easy dish to make!!

Recipe by xaroula
ingredients: 1 little tomato sauce if you like
olive oil, as much as you like

steps.description: Place the potatoes and the carrots in the casserole dish.
Add onion, garlic, a little oil, parsley, the wine, half the tomatoes, a little salt and pepper.
Spread the chicken in the casserole dish.
Add the zucchini.
Pour the rest of the tomato over all.
Add a little more oil and then a little salt and pepper.
Put the lid on the casserole dish and bake for about 1 1/2 depending on the oven.

title: Light chicken with rice
story:
This is basically a simple and quick way to cook chicken. It's nothing really special, however, it's one of the most tasty dishes you can make when you want to cook something particularly light.

Recipe by Sitronella

steps.description: Place the chicken fillets in a non-stick frying pan with a little water. The water should cover a little over the bottom half of the fillets. Boil them in the water.

In the meantime place 1 tbsp olive oil in a pot and add the rice. Mix it with a large spoon so that the oil coats the rice and cook until the rice gets slightly golden. Add twice as much the amount of water to the rice, season with salt, mix a little and let it boil.
Your fillets should be boiling by now. Cover the frying pan with a lid and turn down the heat a little.

Do NOT stir the rice. Allow it to boil. You will see that small "holes" will form from which the steam vents off. Leave it like that (without stirring) until you see that there is no water visible at the bottom any longer.

You can cut the fillets in the middle so that they boil a bit faster and you can be sure that they are cooked all the way through. The juice is going to be quite a small amount, but don't concern yourself with that. Keep them covered to continue boiling. Of course you have to make sure that they are not left without any liquids. If this happens before the chicken is cooked add a little water.
When you see that there is no water left in the rice, turn off the heat, cover with a towel and place the lid on. Set it aside like that for 5 minutes until the chicken is cooked as well.

When all the liquids are absorbed and the chicken is cooled, just leave it a little while longer in the frying pan. It will get a nice golden colour. Turn it over so that it gets golden brown on both sides, of course, don't let it overcook and burn. When it is ready turn off the heat.
Pour a little olive oil on top, salt and a little lemon. If you don't have any stomach troubles, season with oregano and pepper as well.
The rice is also ready. Remove the lid and mix. You will see that it is fluffy and not soggy at all.
Your dish is ready. Serve some chicken and some rice on a plate and see how tasty such a simple dish can be.

title: Chicken Gizzard kebabs (sunakimo)
story:
As part of this year's #cookeverypart challenges we wanted to show some amazing recipes from the global community that use ingredients you might normally throw away.  💪

Week one of the challenge is called "flavour explorer" and asks you for recipes that uses the parts of produce and livestock that is normally under-utilised.
Whether you are using the whole carrot root to top or optimising meat offal offcuts in your cooking, we'd love to see what you are cooking.

We found this yummy recipe on our global Cookpad community in South Africa and wanted to share it with you. It is a classic South African street food style snack prepared either on a grill or hot pan.  The use of chicken gizzards isn't something that most cooks would think of using in the UK but they are a delicious under used part that you can get from your local butchers.

Don't miss out!! If you want to join in? Check out our challenge page here and add your recipe today. https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6705-week-1-flavour-explorer
🐔🥕🍖🍌🧅

This yummy recipe from Abendnico can also be found here:
https://cookpad.com/za/recipes/10095369-gizzard-kebabs-sunakimo

steps.description: Cut the gizzards using the Japanese style of cutting into big chucks and attach to the kebab stick. Any smaller pieces will pan fried after the kebabs
Season with 4tsp of salt, 2 tsp of curry and lamb rub, allow to rest for 5 minutes. Add 2tsp of coconut oil to pan.
Fry until a rich golden brown colour is achieved and turn to the other side.
Ready to serve

title: Extremely easy salad with spinach, beetroot and feta cheese
story:
This is my favorite salad! They make it in many Greek restaurants in Australia and it runs out in no time! Try it first without any variations!!!

Recipe by elinaDxxx
ingredients: 1 1/2 large boiled beetroot from a jar (not the leaves). If you have boiled the beetroot yourselves make sure that they have strained completely, they are cool and slightly sprinkled with vinegar

steps.description: Wash the spinach thoroughly, strain it very well (even better, place it for a while on kitchen paper so that it dries faster) and if there are any larger leaves tear them by hand. Place the spinach in the bowl that you will use to serve the salad in.
Add the beetroot well strained, cut into small pieces (if you have an egg slicer it's even better).
Crumble the feta cheese and add it to the bowl.
Then, add the walnuts, coarsely cut.
Season with salt and pepper (not too much because the beetroot might already be seasoned with salt, plus the feta cheese is salty anyway).
Add the oil and your salad is ready!

title: Quiche Zucchini Chicken (without dough)
story:
As the weather changes in the UK all we want to do is cuddling up in our favourite cosy seat with our favourite comfort food.  Theres nothing quite like #comfortfood to help rejuvenate the soul 🌻 and warm your heart.  ❤️
We'd love to know what your best comfort food is.  Maybe it's a family recipe that reminds you of loved ones or home.  Or maybe it's a dish that you don't have often but when you do it is a real treat and brings you comfort every time to eat it.  It can be sweet or savoury.  

We saw this delicious recipe on our global Cookpad community in France and wanted to share it with you.  Maybe it will become your new comfort food. 😍

Don't miss out!! If you want to join in? Check out our challenge page here and add your recipe today. https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6644-cosy-comfort-food
😍🥮🥧

This yummy recipe is can also be found here:
https://cookpad.com/fr/recettes/15231318-quiche-sans-pate-courgettes-poulet

steps.description: Start by preheating your oven to 180. Wash, dry and cut the zucchini into small cubes. Slice the onion.
In a heavy-bottomed pan, cook the zucchini and onion with a little olive oil, salt, pepper and thyme. In a bowl, beat the eggs with the flour and milk to obtain a smooth mixture.

Once the vegetables are cooked to your liking, add the chicken. Brown everything for 2 minutes. Mix the chicken and vegetables into the batter.
Pour everything into a mold, sprinkle with Parmesan if you want and bake for 45 minutes. You can also eat it cold, warm or hot! 😉 And now it's ready, enjoy ☺️.

title: One Pan Chicken And Vegetables
story:
Autumn 🍁 has officially started and we wanted to celebrate the colours of the season.  This week's challenge "taste of Autumn" lets your imagination run free and lots of you have shared your favourite Autumn recipes inspired by the colours you can see around you. 
We encourage you to share with us your favourite dishes - breakfast, lunch and dinners that are inspired by this colourful season. 

Vibrant yellows, oranges, reds, greens and browns are all being celebrated this week.  This yummy recipe by Jutta from our global Cookpad community in Germany is beautiful and warming for the cold nights ahead of us. 

Don't miss out!! If you want to join in? Check out our challenge page here and add your recipe today. https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6585-taste-of-autumn
🍁🍂🍁🍂
This delicious recipe is by Jutta's and you can be found here:
https://cookpad.com/de/rezepte/15524262-huhnchen-gemuse-pfanne

steps.description: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Cut the spring onions into rings and the peppers into cubes.

Heat the oil in a pan and lightly fry the spring onion.
Add the chicken and continue to fry.
When the chicken looks done, add the curry and peppers, fry again

Then add in the cream (or coconut milk) and stir. Let it boil down a little.
If you like a lot of sauce, double the quantity of cream or milk.
Now season with salt, pepper, soy sauce to taste.
Serve with rice. Enjoy your meal!

title: Margherita Pizza
story:
For this weeks new challenge we have been making Fakeaway dishes, and we encourage you to share with us your favourite restaurant food and Take-away meals that you can recreate and make at home.  

One of our favourite meals to have is pizza, and what better way to take part in the challenge than to make an authentic original Italian pizza from a real Italian home cook.  We saw this recipe by Rosa in out global Cookpad community and just had to try it.

Don't miss out!! Want to join in? Check out our challenge page and add your recipe today using the hashtag #fakeaway in your description.  https://cookpad.com/uk/challenges/6534-tastes-better-at-home
 
This delicious recipe is by Rosa Santarsiero and you can find it here:
https://cookpad.com/it/ricette/15253994-pizza-margherita
ingredients: 8 g fresh bakers yeast (or 2.6g dried yeast)

steps.description:
Pour the flour into a bowl. Dissolve the yeast in water and add to flour. Start mixing with a spoon, and pour in the oil,
sugar, salt and mix.
When the dough begins to mix, continue to knead by hand in the bowl. Cover with a lid and let it rise for 1-11/2 hours in a place without temperature changes.

After rising, drizzle a large pan with oil and roll out the dough into the pan with your hands. In the meantime cook the tomatoes and let them cool down and season. Top the pizza with tomato and mozzarella cheese. Bake in a preheated oven at 200 ° for half an hour, lower the oven to 180 ° and continue to cook until the pizza underneath is raising of the pan with a knife and is golden. 
Decorate with basil. Enjoy your meal

title: Stuffed squid from Chios
story:
The sea, the sea!

Recipe by stroumfita
ingredients: tomato cut into slices and a little grated Parmesan cheese (for garnishing)

steps.description: Wash the squids, clean them and remove the fins which you cut in small pieces to add to the stuffing.

Pour half of the olive oil in the frying pan and sauté the chopped fins, the onion, the garlic and the peppers. Stir in the ouzo, add the parsley, salt, pepper, mix and leave over heat for an additional 2-3 minutes.
As soon as the mixture cools a little add the grated feta cheese (use plenty) and mix.
Stuff the squid with the mixture and use a toothpick to hold the end of the squid tube together and keep the stuffing in.
Pour the rest of the olive oil in a pyrex baking tray and place the squid in it.
Garnish the top of the squid with a slice of tomato (it keeps them from drying out while cooking) and a little grated Parmesan cheese (for a nice crust).
Cover with aluminum foil and bake at 180°C for about 30 minutes. Then remove the aluminum foil and cook for an additional 15 minutes.

title: Kafta: brochettes de viande à la Libanaise
story: Le kafta est composé de viande hachée mélangée avec du persil haché et des oignons. Il est traditionnellement fait en petites galettes ou en forme de doigt et grillé ou poêlé. A déguster avec des frites!
ingredients: 1 kg viande de bœuf ou d'agneau haché finement
1/2 cuillère à café piment de la Jamaïque ou quatre épice
1/4 tasse d'huile végétale, pour la friture

steps.description: Mettre tous les ingrédients dans un bol, sauf l'huile végétale. Bien pétrir jusqu'à ce que les ingrédients formes un grande boule.
Placez le mélange de kafta dans un robot culinaire. Mélanger jusqu'à ce que le tout soit bien mélangé.
Divisez le kafta en boules de la taille d'une balle de golf. Avec vos mains, aplatissez chaque boule pour obtenir une galette de kafta.

Dans une poêle profonde, chauffer l'huile végétale et faire frire les galettes de kafta jusqu'à ce qu'elles brunissent des deux côté. (NB: vous pouvez aussi les faire revenir dans une poêle avec peu d'huile).
Servir chaud accompagné de pommes de terre sautées ou frites et d'une salade.

title: Marinated and baked chicken strips - shawarma djej
story: Shawarma is a very popular dish in Lebanon. Usually we have it in a sandwich that we buy from sandwich shops. Here is a delicious homemade chicken shawarma recipe: Chicken strips are marinated in a garlic and vinegar sauce then oven baked. It is best served with garlic cream and pickles.
ingredients: 2 kg chicken breasts, cut into thin fajita-like strips

steps.description: In a large bowl, place the chicken strips and all the marinade ingredients together. Mix well and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hr.
Transfer the chicken and its marinade to a baking tray. Place the tray in the oven, at medium heat, for 30 to 40 min or until the chicken is tender.
Serve the chicken shawarma with garlic cream, fried potatoes and pickles.
Note: You can find the recipe 'garlic cream' under my profile.

title: Rice pudding - riz bi haleeb
story: A thick rice and milk pudding flavored with orange blossom water, rose water and mastic gum. Serve with jam or jelly.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch dissolved in ½ cup water
1/2 teaspoon mastic gum, crushed with 1 teaspoon of sugar

steps.description: In a non-sticky or stainless steel pot, put the milk and rice with ½ cup water and a dash of salt. Put on medium heat and stir until the mixture thickens.
While continuously stirring, add sugar and the dissolved cornstarch.
After 5 min, turn the heat off; add the rose water, orange blossom water and mastic gum.
Pour in serving cups and leave them to cool. Put the rice pudding in the refrigerator for a minimum of 2 hr before serving.
You can serve plain or with jam next to it.

title: Turkish coffee - kahwa turqiyyeh
story: You need a rakweh, a special coffee pot, to brew this finely ground coffee. A distinctive strong smell and taste! Serve in small coffee cups.

steps.description: Boil the water in a coffee pot.
Remove from heat, add the Turkish coffee powder and stir.

Put the coffee pot back over heat and leave to boil making sure that the coffee doesn't spill out of the pot. To prevent spilling, move away the pot from the heat every time the coffee starts rising then place it back over the heat.
After about 30 seconds of boiling, remove from heat, cover the pot and leave it aside for 1 min while the coffee grounds settle at the bottom of the pot.
Serve in small coffee cups.

title: Date stuffed cookies - maamoul bi tamer
story: Semolina-based cookies that are stuffed with a date paste, then shaped and decorated either by hand or using a special wooden mold. Maamoul is usually served during religious festivities. A tantalizing smell while baking in the oven!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon dried yeast, dissolved in 2 tablespoons warm water

steps.description: In a bowl, mix the semolina and ferkha flour with the butter. Cover with a kitchen cloth and leave overnight.
Add the orange blossom water, rose water and dissolved yeast to the flour and butter mixture. Knead until you get a soft dough.
To prepare the stuffing: melt the butter in a saucepan, add the date paste and mahlab then mash the mix with the back of a spoon until pureed.
Divide the date paste into small cherry-sized balls and leave them aside for later use.
Divide the dough into walnut-sized balls. Place the dough ball in the palm of your hand and with your finger make a hole in it. Fill it with a date paste ball; close the dough and roll into a ball.
Place the ball into the maamoul mold and pack it well inside it for the dough to take the shape of the mold. To unmold, flip the mold and tap it on the table. The cookie will fall out.
Place the maamoul in an oven tray and bake at high temperature for about 15 to 20 min or until they are blushed.
Note: These cookies have a long shelf-life. They can be stored in an airtight container.

title: Dried fruit salad - khoshaf
story: A dessert made of dried fruits soaked in apricot juice and decorated with almonds and pine nuts. It's a healthy and refreshing Syrian dessert. Any other juice can be used for the soaking.
ingredients: 1 liter apricot juice, or any other juice like qamar ed-deen - apricot sherbet - or tang juice

steps.description: Soak all the dried fruits together in the chosen juice.
Leave it for 4 hr then add the orange blossom water and sugar.
Pour into serving glasses and sprinkle with the nuts.
You can soak the nuts in water before serving.
Note: You can find the recipe 'Apricot sherbet' under my profile.

title: Chicken and vermicelli soup - shorbet djej
story: A soothing chicken and vermicelli soup. Not your standard get-well chicken soup! Try it!

steps.description: In a pressure cooker, heat the vegetable oil and fry the chicken thighs for 3 min.
Add the onion, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, white pepper, nutmeg, and salt. Cover with 2 liters of water and close pressure cooker securely.
Cook for 25 min at highest pressure (achieved when steam starts escaping). Remove from heat and let pressure drop before opening cooker cover (achieved when all steam escapes).

Strain the chicken broth into a cooking pot. Make sure you remove the cinnamon sticks, bay leaves, and the onion. Remove bones from chicken; cut the chicken into small pieces and add them to the broth.
Add the lemon juice and vermicelli. Season with salt and place the pot on medium heat for 5 min before serving the soup.

title: Casserole of eggplants stuffed with ground meat - sheikh el mehshi
story: Fried small eggplants are stuffed with a mixture of ground meat, onions and pine nuts then baked in tomato sauce. It is served with vermicelli rice.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons tomato paste, dissolved in 3 cups water
3/4 cup vegetable oil, for frying eggplants
2 tablespoons vegetable oil, for frying onions, pine nuts and meat

steps.description: In a deep skillet, heat the vegetable oil and fry the eggplants on high heat until tender and brown. Remove from oil and place on a kitchen absorbent paper.

In another skillet fry the chopped onion until golden and tender, add the pine nuts, toss for a few seconds then add the ground meat with the cinnamon, nutmeg, salt and pepper and stir until meat is brown. Set aside.
In a baking tray, place the fried eggplants and make a slit, lengthwise, in the middle of each one. Fill each eggplant with enough ground meat.
Layer the tomato slices over them and pour the dissolved tomato paste. Make sure the eggplants are covered with water. Sprinkle with salt.
Bake in the oven on medium heat for around 30 min. Do not allow all liquid to evaporate.
Serve with vermicelli rice on the side.
Note: You can find the recipe 'vermicelli rice' under my profile.

title: Spinach and meat stew - sabanegh bi lahmeh
story: A spinach stew cooked with ground meat, onions and pine nuts. It is served with vermicelli rice.
ingredients: 2 kg spinach, thoroughly cleaned and coarsely chopped

steps.description: Place a deep pot on high heat, heat the vegetable oil and fry the onions until golden.
Add the pine nuts to the onions then add the meat and brown it. Add salt and pepper. Stir well.
Add the spinach and water to the pot. Leave on medium heat for 30 min. Stir occasionally. If needed add more water.
Turn off the heat and pour the lemon juice over the spinach.
Once served adjust lemon juice and salt to taste.
Serve with vermicelli rice.
Note: You can find the recipe 'vermicelli rice' under my profile.

title: Butter cookies - ghraybeh
story: White-colored butter cookies that are decorated with pistachios. They melt in the mouth!

steps.description: Mix the powdered sugar and butter with an electric blender until it turns into a whitish paste. Move the mixture to a bowl.

Add in the flour and mix with your hands until you get a smooth dough. Knead slightly.
Put the dough in the refrigerator for 1 hr.
Remove dough from refrigerator and divide it into walnut-sized balls. Roll each ball into a finger-like shape and close the ends together forming a ring.
Decorate each cookie with a pistachio.
Arrange the cookies on a slightly greased baking tray leaving at least 1 cm between each cookie.
Bake in the oven at a low temperature for 20 min until they become slightly blushed.
Let the cookies cool before serving.

title: Semolina and cheese cake - knafeh bi jibneh
story: A warm two-layer dessert made of semolina dough and unsalted cheese, baked and served with sugar syrup. Perfect for a brunch!
ingredients: 500 g akkawi cheese, if available, or any other unsalted white cheese like mozzarella

steps.description: To get a completely unsalted cheese, soak in water for 24 hr. Make sure to change the water 4 to 5 times.

To prepare the sugar syrup: put the sugar and water in a small saucepan and place over medium heat. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Leave to boil then add the lemon juice and keep on medium heat for 10 min until the syrup thickens. Add the orange blossom water and rose water. Remove from heat and transfer to a large bowl.

Spread the knafeh dough in a 35 cm diameter baking pan forming a layer of around 1.5 cm in thickness. Bake the dough in the oven at medium heat, until the bottom and the side of the dough turn golden in color.
Cut the cheese in small cubes and place them in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the water oozes out. Discard the water.
Add in the fine semolina and ½ cup of the syrup and mix. When the cheese mixture starts boiling, remove from heat and pour over the baked knafeh dough.
Place a large serving tray over the knafeh pan and turn the pan upside down. Let the knafeh drop on the serving tray while slowly removing the pan.
Cut the knafeh into square pieces and serve warm with sugar syrup.

title: Oven baked fish with chili - samkeh harra
story: There are different ways to prepare this dish. In this recipe, the whole fish is stuffed with chili peppers, garlic and coriander then baked with lemon, tomato, green pepper and onion slices. A delight for your taste buds!
ingredients: 3 lemons, peeled and cut in round slices
2 green hot peppers, cut in halves with seeds removed
1 red hot pepper, cut in half with seeds removed

steps.description: Pre-heat the oven on high heat.
To prepare the stuffing: put all the ingredients together in a food processor and blend until you obtain a homogeneous mixture.
Using a knife, make 3 cuts on both sides of the fish. Fill in the cuts with the stuffing. With the remaining stuffing, rub the whole fish.
In an oven tray, pour the vegetable oil and place the fish.
Put the tray in the oven and bake the fish for 20 min. Remove the tray from the oven, spread the tomato, pepper, onion and lemon slices over the fish randomly.
Cover the tray with aluminum foil and put it back in the oven for about 1 hr until it is well cooked.
Place the fish in a serving dish and decorate it with the grilled sliced vegetables.
Serve hot with pita bread.

title: Fried okra
story:
If you like okra, just fry them and enjoy!!!

Recipe by pinalaki
ingredients: 500 g okra (the large ones, don't use small ones because they will disintegrate)

steps.description: Clean the okra and place them in a strainer after sprinkling them with vinegar so they don't get slimy!
Set them aside for half an hour and then rinse well.
Now you can cook them.
Bring a little water to the boil and blanch them (place the okra in the boiling water for a couple of minutes and then strain them).
Heat the oil well and meanwhile coat the okra in flour after seasoning with salt.
Place them in the hot oil as they are coated in flour (so that they get a crisp coating) and fry.

title: Colourful Oshi Sushi (Pressed Sushi) with Chicken Teriyaki
story:
I wanted to serve up a good-looking chicken teriyaki dish for a party, so I came up with this.

Don't overcook or undercook the chicken. Pack the ingredients into a mold, then press down on them firmly to get a well-formed pressed sushi. If you don't press hard enough, the sushi will fall apart easily when you slice it. Recipe by Rirapen
ingredients: 6 tomatoes Cherry tomatoes (Cut a cherry tomato into eight pieces)

steps.description: Put the eggs and milk in a bowl and stir. Heat a pot, and pour the mixture into it. Hold four cooking chopsticks with one hand and stir the mixture with them to make scrambled eggs.
Make a slit on the chicken thigh on the meat side. Arrange the chicken thighs skin side-down in a frying-pan.
Heat the frying-pan, and cook the chicken over medium heat until golden brown. Turn the chicken thigh over, and once it begins to sizzle, cover with a lid and continue to cook.
Drizzle the soy sauce and honey over the chicken, coating evenly. Let it cool, dicing the chicken up. Save the sauce that's left in the pan.

Line the pound cake tin with plastic wrap. Add the ingredients in layers starting with the chicken thigh, then rice, scrambled egg, cheese, scrambled egg and rice. Press hard from the top to pack the ingredients in tightly.
Serve the sushi on a plate. Heat the sauce in the frying-pan and it pour over the sushi. Garnish with cherry tomatoes and radish sprouts.

title: Inari Sushi with Nuts and Dried Fruits
story:
I originally created this recipe as an entry for a recipe contest sponsored by the company that sells the nuts and dried fruits I used. However, the theme of the contest was rather extravagant and I didn't think this fit well, so I entered it in a healthy eating recipe contest sponsored by another company instead. 
I made these inari sushi with the rice showing so they would be fun to look at.

I used the sweetness of the dried fruit only, and didn't add any sugar to the rice (as you usually would to sushi rice). 
They are good when they're freshly made, but they are also delicious if made ahead of time for a party. I personally like them better after they have rested for a while. Recipe by Mizuki shan
ingredients: 8 inarizushi worth Precooked aburaage for inari sushi

steps.description: I used these pine nuts, apricots and cranberries. I like the packaging, which clearly lists the nutritional information of the contents.
Wash 1 rice cooker cup worth of rice, and add a bit less water than usual. Put in the dried fruit, sake, and dashi stock granules.
I used these store-bought inari sushi skins.
Add the pine nuts to the freshly cooked rice, squeeze in the juice of one sudachi, and mix. The apricots will melt a little and add a subtle color to the rice.
I wanted to use the sourness of the sudachi juice only, but I found that vinegar is needed after all. Add 1 tablespoon of vinegar and mix.
Chop up the daikon radish sprouts and mix them into the rice. Stuff the rice into the inari sushi skins, and they're done.
Bonus:  I didn't have enough of the premade inari sushi skins, so I chopped up 2 of them and mixed them with the remaining rice for a chirashi sushi-style dish.

title: Chirashi Sushi (5 Ingredient Chirashi Sushi)
story:
This is my family's chirashi sushi. It's delicious! Be careful not to eat too much!!!

The fillings are rather moist, so it makes the entire dish moist and delicious.
It's delicious when you use homemade dried shiitake mushrooms. Recipe by Cooking S Papa
ingredients: 80 grams Cooked bamboo shoots in brine
300 ml Water from re-hydrating shiitake mushrooms

steps.description: Cook the rice with the konbu. Use a little less water than usual.
Moisten the gourds with water, then rub with a generous amount of salt. Boil for 5 minutes, then finely chop.
Re-hydrate the shiitake mushrooms in 300 ml of water. You will use the liquid later, so keep it. Re-hydrate the koya dofu in water as well (about 3 minutes).
Chop the gourds, carrots, bamboo shoots, shiitake mushrooms, koya dofu, and kamaboko into 5-8 mm chunks.
Combine all the sushi vinegar ingredients into a pot and turn on the heat. Once the salt and sugar has dissolved, immediately turn off the heat and let cool.
If you cut the kinshi tamago into squares, you can make it look real nice. You can give the rough ends to your kids to eat. Slice the egg crepe to make kinshi tamago.

Simmer the filling ingredients. Bring the liquid to a boil, then cook the shiitake, carrots, and bamboo shoots over low heat. After 15 minutes, add all remaining fillings and let cook for 2 more minutes to let the flavors absorb.
Transfer to a shallow container and let cool. When cooking the rice, cook with a little less water than usual and cook with the konbu. Once cooked, remove the konbu.
Mix up the rice in the rice pot and add the sushi vinegar, then mix into the rice with the rice spatula using cutting motions. Once mixed in, cool with a hand fan to bring out the shine.
Mix together with the cooled fillings, then garnish with the kinshi tamago, shredded nori, and sesame seeds. Serve with the beni shouga and enjoy!

To make kinshi tamago, see.

https://cookpad.com/us/recipes/152675-ultra-thin-and-beautiful-shredded-egg-for-chirashi-sushi

To make your own dried shiitake mushrooms, see.

https://cookpad.com/us/recipes/143982-sun-dried-shiitake-mushrooms-with-butter-and-soy-sauce
You can make a very colorful chirashi sushi by adding shrimp or salmon, tuna, mackerel, octopus, squid, salmon roe, etc on top!

title: Chicken with rice and ground meat - riz 3a djej
story: In this recipe, the rice is cooked with ground meat in chicken broth. It is then served with roasted chicken on top and garnished with roasted almonds and pine nuts.

steps.description: In a frying pan, lightly fry the chicken pieces on both sides in 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil. Remove and put in a saucepan. The chicken shouldn't be completely cooked.

Add 2 liters of water over the chicken pieces and let it boil. As the water boils remove with a spoon any foam that might form on the water surface. Discard. Once the foam removed add 1 onion, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods and bay leaves to the water. Cover the pan with a lid keeping a small opening to prevent the water to overflow while boiling. Keep on medium heat until the chicken is well cooked.
Once cooked, remove the chicken from the saucepan and set aside. Strain the chicken broth and keep aside for later use.
In a deep pan, fry the chopped onion with 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil until golden, then add the ground meat and keep on cooking until meat turns brown.
Add the rice, salt, pepper and cinnamon. Toss for 2 min then add 4 cups of chicken broth. Cover and let it simmer for 25 min or until rice is well cooked.
To serve, put the rice in a large plate, place the chicken pieces on top. Sprinkle with the roasted almonds and pine nuts.

title: Casserole of baby zucchini stuffed with ground meat - koussa ablama
story: A refined dish where baby zucchini are filled with a mixture of ground meat and pine nuts then lightly fried and baked with tomato sauce. It is served with vermicelli rice.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon tomato paste, dissolved in 1 cup of water

steps.description: Trim the ends of the zucchini. With a corer, pierce the top and remove the insides, making sure to keep a relatively thick outer layer that can hold the stuffing.
To prepare the stuffing: fry the pine nuts and onions in 4 tablespoons of vegetable oil until pine nuts are slightly roasted and the onions are soft.
Stir in the meat, pepper, cinnamon and salt. Cook for 10 min until the meat is done. Remove from heat and let it cool.
Stuff the zucchini, making sure they are fully stuffed.
In a saucepan, fry the stuffed zucchini in ¾ cup of vegetable oil, turning them every few minutes until both sides are slightly brown. Remove from oil and arrange them in a baking tray.
Preheat the oven to medium heat.
Put the tomato slices on top of the zucchini and pour over the dissolved tomato paste. Add enough water to cover the zucchinis and tomato slices.
Add 1 teaspoon of salt and bake in the oven for 30 min or until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot with vermicelli rice.
Note: You can find the recipe 'vermicelli rice' under my profile.

title: How to Make a Beautiful Egg Salad Sandwich
