story: I wanted to make a tasty egg salad sandwich and I love making dishes for events. A lot of my recipes are easy enough so your kids can help out too! (Recipe by Kodomoto Tsukuru Uchigohan)

steps.description: Boil the eggs, and scramble while hot. Season with salt and pepper, then chill overnight in refrigerator.
The next day, add the mayonnaise to balance the flavors. Put sandwich ham, cucumbers, and the egg salad between the sliced bread, and serve.
Recipe Tip: To help the flavors come together more easily, season with salt and pepper while hot, and add the mayonnaise after it cools!

title: Pancakes stuffed with ashta cream - atayef bi ashta
story: Atayef are small, light, and fluffy pancakes. In this recipe they are filled with ashta cream and served with sugar syrup. A heavenly treat!
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon dried yeast dissolved in 2 tablespoons of warm water
- For the ashta cream: prepare ahead of time
4 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch, dissolved in ¼ cup water

steps.description: To prepare the sugar syrup: put the sugar and water in a small saucepan and place over medium heat. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Leave to boil then add the lemon juice and keep on medium heat for 10 min until the syrup thickens. Add the orange blossom water and rose water. Remove from heat and transfer to a large bowl.
To prepare the batter: mix all the ingredients together. Leave to rest for 3 hr at room temperature or overnight in the refrigerator.

To prepare the atayef pancakes: delicately pour 1 large serving spoon of batter on a slightly greased pan. You should have an 8 cm diameter pancake. Cook on one side only. Bubbles will form on the surface of the dough. The pancakes are ready to be removed when the bubbles burst and the bottom of the pancake is slightly brown. The pancakes should be firm enough to be filled but they shouldn't be fully cooked. Repeat with the rest of the batter.

To prepare the ashta cream: Cut off the edges of the bread. Discard. Cut in dices the soft white part. Place the bread dices in a saucepan and pour the milk and whipping cream over them. Let the bread dices soak in the milk and cream mixture for at least 2 hr in the refrigerator. Put the saucepan on medium heat and, with a wooden spoon, start stirring the bread and milk mixture. Once the milk starts heating, add the water-dissolved cornstarch. Continue stirring until the mixture thickens. Once d
Fill each pancake with 1 to 2 tablespoons of ashta cream, close it from one side and keep it open from the other.
Garnish with ground pistachios or candied orange blossoms. Add sugar syrup to taste while serving.
Note: You can find the recipe 'Ashta cream' under my profile.

title: Semolina dough grains with chicken - moghrabieh
story: Moghrabieh are semolina dough grains. They are cooked with chicken broth and served with chicken pieces on top.  A great get-together dish!
ingredients: 1 kg moghrabieh, fresh, frozen or dried

steps.description: In a deep pan, fry the chicken thighs and breasts with 4 tablespoons of vegetable oil for 2 min. Add 1½ liters water, one whole onion, the bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, caraway, cinnamon powder, cumin, some pepper and salt.
Cover and cook until chicken is well done. Remove chicken pieces and set aside. Strain the chicken broth and reserve.
In a deep pot, fry the moghrabieh with 3 tablespoons of olive oil until golden. Sprinkle with some caraway, cinnamon and salt.
Boil 1 liter of water then add it to the moghrabieh and let it cook for 10 min only. Remove from heat, drain the half-cooked moghrabieh from its water and set it aside.
Fry the whole onions in a cooking pot with the 4 tablespoons of oil until they turn golden.

Add in the moghrabieh, chickpeas and enough chicken broth to cover the ingredients. Place pot on high heat and let it simmer with the lid on until most of the broth has been absorbed by the moghrabieh. Make sure not to totally dry the moghrabieh. Remove from heat and add more seasoning if needed.
To serve, place the moghrabieh in a serving dish and arrange the chicken pieces on top. Pour the rest of the chicken broth in a bowl and add to your dish according to taste.

title: Lemonade - lemonada
story: It's not just water, lemon and sugar. It's a perfect lemonade recipe with a twist of orange blossom water that makes it so typically Lebanese!

steps.description: Wash the lemons and peel one of them. Keep the lemon rind aside.
Squeeze all 5 lemons and mix the lemon juice with the water. Add the lemon rind.
Mix in the sugar and leave for 1 hr.
Strain the mixture through a fine sieve into a juice jug and add the orange blossom water. Let it cool in the refrigerator.
Serve cold with crushed ice.

title: Stuffed cabbage leaf rolls - Warak malfoof mehshi
story: Boiled cabbage leaves are stuffed with a mixture of rice and meat, rolled and cooked in lemon juice. This main dish can be served with plain yogurt.

steps.description: Boil 1 liter of water in a pan then add the cabbage leaves and the cumin. Cook for 3 min until leaves become tender. Remove them slowly, one at a time and place on a plate for cooling.
Remove the stems of the boiled leaves and cut the leaves into squares.
To prepare the stuffing: mix together the ground beef, rice, 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil, cinnamon, pepper and salt. Combine well.

Place 2 teaspoons of the stuffing in the middle of each square cabbage leaf in a straight line. Roll the leaf over the stuffing while making sure to tuck in the ends so that the stuffing does not spill out.
In a deep saucepan, add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Layer the stuffed cabbage leaves inside the pan, making sure that they are arranged tightly one next to the other. Cover with water.
In a bowl, mix the sauce ingredients together and pour them over the cabbage rolls.
Place a plate, face inwards, on top of the contents to weigh them down while cooking.
Cover the saucepan and cook the cabbage leaves over low heat for around 35 min or until the rice and meat are cooked. Turn off the heat and remove the plate.
Serve the cabbage rolls in a serving dish displayed in layers.

title: Spinach Pie with Homemade Filo Dough
story: This spinach pie was voted by Greek Cookpad members on facebook to be sent to Cookpad Italia, as part of a recipe exchange. However, there was a person that actually asked for the recipe in English. Therefore, as Cookpad is a big, multilingual family, we had to add this delicious pie to Cookpad UK as well! It belongs to our user emanuela (https://cookpad.com/gr/xristes/8524809) and you can see it to Cookpad Greece (https://cookpad.com/gr/sintages/3088247-spanakopita-me-spitiki-spholiata) and to Cookpad Italia (https://cookpad.com/it/ricette/4776345-%F0%9F%87%AC%F0%9F%87%B7-torta-di-spinaci-con-pasta-fillo-fatta-in-casa). Hope you will enjoy it!
ingredients: Lukewarm water (as much as it takes)

steps.description: We prepare the phyllo dough. In a baking tray we add the flour and we make a well in the center. We pour in the vinegar and we start mixing the dough with our hands adding the water in little bits.
After mixing for a while, the dough should become a smooth, elastic, plastic ball.
We divide the dough into 8 pieces, we cover them with s clean towel, and we let them rest.

We prepare the filling of the spinach pie. In a big mixing bowl we strain the spinach to remove any excess liquid. We mix in the spring onions, the dill, the spearmint, the olive oil, the feta cheese, the egg, and the yoghurt and we season with salt and pepper.
We pick up 4 out of 8 dough pieces and we roll each one of them into a 20 cm diameter phyllo dough sheet. We end up with 4 phyllo dough sheets.

We place the first phyllo dough sheet on our working surface and we spread on top olive oil mixed with butter. Then we place on top the second sheet and spread again on top olive oil mixed with butter. We repeat with the third and fourth sheet.
We press gently the sheets with the roller.
We roll all the four sheets into one single phyllo dough sheet.

We start the pie by laying the phyllo dough sheet in a baking tray. We brush it with olive oil and we add the filling. We repeat the procedure with the other 4 dough pieces to make a second phyllo dough sheet and we add it on top of the filling.
We preheat the oven to 180°C. We brush the second phyllo dough sheet with olive oil and we score the top with a knife. Finally we sprinkle sesame seeds on top and we bake the spinach pie in the oven.

title: Red pepper and walnut spread - muhammara
story: A chili spread made of red pepper, walnuts, onions, bread crumbs, lemon juice and olive oil. A tasty appetizer served with pita bread.
ingredients: 2 cups walnuts, coarsely ground, or 250 g whole walnuts
5 teaspoons dried red chili pepper powder, diluted in 1/3 cup of warm water

steps.description: In a food processor, blend the ground walnuts, the bread crumbs and olive oil together.
Add the red chili pepper powder diluted in 1/3 cup of water, and the lemon juice. Blend again.
Finally, mix in the pomegranate syrup, the cumin and the salt.
The end result should be a smooth paste that is reddish/ light brown.
Serve with pita bread.
Heat the oil in a strong earthenware casserole dish and sauté the onion, garlic and green pepper for about 5 mins, then add the eggplant and continue frying for another 5 mins over a low heat.
Add tomatoes and zucchini, season with salt and pepper and add the oregano - cover and continue frying for a further 15 mins over a medium to low heat.
Remove from the heat when the vegetables are well cooked - can be served hot or cold.
Wash the spinach thoroughly and cut the rough stems off.
Cook the spinach in very little water in a covered pan for 5 mins then drain and chop.

Heat the olive oil over a medium to low heat and add the finely sliced garlic, sultanas and pine nuts. Fry gently for 2 - 3 mins, stirring all the time so that the pine nuts brown but do not burn. Add the spinach.
Mix all ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.
Cut pork into cubes, getting as much as the fat off the pork as possible. Fry the pork cubes until browned.
Chop the onion and crush the garlic then add to the pork in the frying pan
Peel and chop the tomatoes and add to the frying pan then season with salt and add the bay-leaf
Cook over a low heat until the pork is tender and the sauce has thickened (this usually takes approx. 25 - 30 mins).
Heat the oil in a frying pan, add the lamb chops and brown on both sides then place in a casserole dish and set aside.
Chop and sauté the onion in the frying pan using the same oil then add the crushed garlic - fry for a few minutes.
Add the tomatoes to the frying pan and season with salt - after 5 mins add the mixture to the lamb chops in the casserole dish.
Cover the casserole dish and place in a preheated oven (180°C/350°F) for about 30 mins until the lamb chops are tender.

title: Grilled sardines
story: You can also cook the sardines over a barbeque following the above recipe. If you don't want your kitchen to smell of sardines for hours afterwards, we recommend outdoor cooking . Encourage your guests to eat the sardines with their fingers. For some reason they are much more satisfying that way. Provide bowls with warm water and lemon slices in for people to wash their fingers in afterwards. Guarenteed to get the fishy smell off hands.. Make sure the griddle is very very hot before starting to grill the sardines. Use coarse salt if you can.

steps.description: Remove the scales from the sardines and season with salt (you don´t need to remove the heads or guts).
Heat a griddle pan and place the sardines on it when hot.
The sardines will need about 2 mins on each side.
Serve with a chunk of white bread.
Chop the onion and sauté in 2 Tbsp olive oil in a frying pan
Cut up the chorizo and set aside.
Rinse the cooked chickpeas well and then add them to the fried onion together with 1/2 tsp paprika - continue frying for a further 5 mins.
Add the chopped chorizo and fry a little longer before serving.
Prepare the aubergines by peeling them and cutting into cubes
Heat the oil in a frying pan add the aubergine cubes and sauté for a few minutes
Add the chopped onion, crushed garlic and paprika to the aubergine in the frying pan and fry over a low heat for a further 5 mins
Add the chopped tomatoes season with salt and pepper
Cover the frying pan and cook for a further 15 minutes (checking that the aubergine is well cooked)
Place in a serving dish and garnish with a little chopped fresh parsley

title: Tomato sauce (Salsa de tomate or Tomate frito)
ingredients: 3 soup spoons of cold olive oil

steps.description: Put the oil in a frying pan and fry the chopped onion and garlic for about four minutes. Peel and chop the tomatoes and add them to the onion and garlic (if you haven't got any fresh tomatoes, you can use tinned)

With the edge of a spatula mash the tomatoes, onion and garlic up as they cook, for about 15 minutes on a moderate heat. When the mixture is cooked, take off the heat and liquidize so that you are left with a thick tomato sauce.
Chop some leaves of basil, and add this together with the salt and sugar.
Send us your favourite recipe
sieve the flour into a bowl and add a pinch of salt
Make a hole in the middle of the flour and add 1 tbsp olive oil and the beer or lager
stir the mixture well working it from the centre outwards until it has a smooth consistency - put aside at room temperature for 30 mins
peel the prawns leaving part of the shell at the tail end
whisk the egg whites until stiff then add to the batter
heat enough oil in a pan to deep fry the prawns
place the pawns in the batter one by one and fry them a few at a time until the batter has turned golden and the prawns are done
remove the prawns from the oil and drain off excess oil by placing them on a plate covered with kitchen paper
be careful not to fry too many prawn at once or they will stick together in the frying pan

title: Green olives in a herb sauce

steps.description: Crush the olives (you don´t need to remove the stones) by bashing them with a rolling pin
Place the olives, crushed garlic cloves and chopped parsley in a glass jar and pour over some olive oil (about 2 tbsp) - shake all ingredients together keep in the fridge before serving
Slice the aubergine (about 1 cm thick)
Beat the egg add a couple of pinches of salt and set aside in a bowl
Put the flour on a large plate
Heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat
Take each aubergine slice and dip in the egg then the flour

Fry immediately for about 3 - 5 mins turning once when the slices have turned golden brown on each side remove from the frying pan and drain off excess oil by placing them on kitchen paper on a plate before serving
Tips and Ideas:
In the Basque Country the aubergine slices are eaten as pinchos placed on small pieces of crusty white bread often with a piece of serrano ham on top secured in place by a cocktail stick
Salt the pieces of fish and squeeze a little fresh lemon over them and set aside
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and fry the bread and garlic until golden - remove from the pan and set aside - it´s better to do this slowly over a medium to low heat
Add the chopped onion to the oil and fry for a few minutes until softened
Place the bread, garlic, oil from the pan and onion together with the saffron, parsley, cummin and wine in a blender and mix until you get a smooth sauce

Arrange the fish in the frying pan then pour the sauce into the pan and cook over a medium heat untill the sauce begins to simmer then cover and cook for a further 10 mins - add a little water if the sauce gets too thick
Check that the fish is ready then garnish with the fresh chopped parsley and serve with fresh lemon slices

title: Fried pineapple in rum
story: This delicious recipe with pineapple uses rum to give it an extra zing

steps.description: Remove the rough peel from the pineapple and slice into rectangular pieces
Place the pineapple pieces in a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat together with the sunflower oil and cook so that the pineapple turns golden brown
Remove from the heat and pour the rum over the pineapple letting it mix with the pineapple juice in the frying pan
Place the golden pineapple pieces in a dish and pour over the remaining liquid from the pan and serve.
Heat the olive oil in a casserole dish and add the chicken pieces and cook until they are browned
Chop the onion and ham and slice the mushrooms >
Add the onion, ham and mushrooms to the casserole dish and sauté for 5 - 10 mins
Pour in the sherry add the bay leaf and season with salt and pepper
Cover and simmer until the chicken is tender (approx 20 mins)
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan
add the almonds and move them around the pan constantly for about 1 min
when the almonds have browned remove from the frying pan and place on a plate covered with kitchen pape
sprinkle with sea salt (the coarser the better) and leave to cool before eating
Be careful not to burn the almonds - they turn golden brown very quickly once the oil is hot and it can be a matter of seconds before they start to burn
Peeling almonds is time consuming and very fiddley so try and get ready peeled ones for this recipe.

title: Hard Boiled Egg Recipe
story:
This #CookpadBasics recipe explains how to hard boil an egg. You could eat your egg(s) hot, with a sprinkling of salt, pepper and perhaps some paprika. Or allow to cool and add to salads, sandwiches or egg mayo. 

Watch this recipe being made here - https://youtu.be/fWqrltvkqKQ

steps.description: Bring a small saucepan of water up to a rolling boil (where the water is bubbling but not too vigorously).
Gently lower your egg into the water and allow the egg to boil gently for 10 minutes.

Remove the egg carefully and place into a bowl of chilled water. You can peel your egg as soon as it is cool enough to touch, if you want to eat it hot. Or allow it to cool completely in the cold water before peeling to use in salads etc.

title: Soft Boiled Egg Recipe
story:
This #CookpadBasics recipe will help you to master the art of soft boiling an egg (cooking an egg in its shell so that the yolk is runny). This is not always as easy as it sounds and the cooking time will vary slightly depending on the size and temperature of your egg. This recipe uses a chilled, medium sized egg.

Watch this recipe being made here - https://youtu.be/TDM_1njydaE

steps.description: Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil.
Carefully lower your egg into the water using a spoon.

Allow the water to bubble gently as you boil your egg for 6 minutes. Set a timer on your phone or using an egg timer, we recommend you don’t rely on a clock or guesswork if you want a perfect soft boiled egg!
Lift the egg out carefully using a spoon and place it directly into an egg cup.

title: Simple Oven Baked Jacket Potato
story:
A simple oven baked jacket potato makes a nutritious, budget and healthy meal. This #CookpadBasics recipe is great as a side or main meal. Top with butter or olive oil, salt and freshly ground pepper, egg mayo, hummus baked beans and cheese .... or whatever else takes your fancy. You could also rub the skin with olive oil, salt and pepper before baking, for a crispier crust. Don’t forget to share your jacket potato Cooksnaps with us!

Watch this recipe being made here - https://youtu.be/kl_ob-mBAZ8

steps.description: Preheat the oven to 190C.
Clean your potato removing any dirt and blemishes.
Use a fork to prick the skin of the potato all over. This will stop the skin splitting or (worst case) the potato exploding in the oven.

Place the potato on a baking tray and roast in the oven until a skewer or sharp knife slides easily through your potato. The baking time will vary depending on the size of potato, but 1 - 1 1/2 hours would be a good starting point.

title: Saba Sushi (Cured and Pressed Mackerel Sushi)
story:
I love saba sushi, but it's hard to find one in stores that's made just to my taste, so I make my own. For the sugar marinating step, I've used Chef Hiromitsu Nozaki's method as reference.

Adjust the time you marinate the fish in salt and vinegar to taste. After forming the sushi, if you refrigerate it, the rice will harden. If you wrap the sushi in a towel and put it in the vegetable compartment (the warmest part of the refrigerator) or similar, you can prevent the rice from becoming too hard. Recipe by Monzu kitchen

steps.description: Rub both sides of the fish fillets with sugar, place in a shallow tray, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Rinse off both sides of the fillets under running water, and pat dry with paper towels. Rub salt into both sides, place in a shallow tray, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 3 hours.
Rinse off both sides of the fillets under running water, and pat dry with paper towels.

Pour the vinegar into the shallow tray with the fillets placed skin side down. Place a paper towel on top of the fish so that they are immersed in the vinegar. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Peel off the skin with your fingers.
Remove any remaining bones with fish bone tweezers.
Wipe off the vinegar well with paper towels.
Wrap the fillets in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for half a day.
Mix sushi vinegar into freshly cooked hot rice using a rice paddle. Fan to cool it down. (I have added some pickled ginger and toasted sesame seeds to the rice here).
Slice off a bit of the fish in the middle that is thicker than the rest, and stick it on to the tail end to even out the thickness.
Line a makisu (sushi rolling mat) with plastic wrap, and place a mackerel fillet on it skin side down. Cover evenly with sushi rice, and roll with the mat.
Press down with your hands to even out the shape. Secure the mat with elastic bands, leave for 2 to 3 hours and it's done.

title: Sushi Rice
story:
Regular sushi rice is a bit sweet, so I made this sushi rice to use in California rolls.

Make sure to thoroughly fan air onto the rice while mixing in cutting motions during Step 2. Recipe by Mie-

steps.description: Combine the ☆ ingredients and mix well until the sugar and salt dissolve.
Add the cooked rice to Step 1 and mix together with cutting motions while fanning. Once it has cooled, it's ready to be used.

title: Panqueques con dulce de leche
story: Here is the delicious recipe of Argentinian pancake with Nuttela. It's so delicious and easy to make. This is the result from the Global cook along with Norali-Cookpad Argentina and Yui-Cookpad UK

steps.description: On a big mixing bowl, put plain flour, egg, salt in and mix all together with a spoon. Then add some milk a little at the time. Mix them all well.
Add some melted butter in and stir well. Rest your batter for at least 30 min. but if you want to cook straight away you can use hand blender blend the ingredients together.

Turn on a medium heat on a non stick pan. use some cooking oil or cooking oil spray sprays on the pan. Pour about 1 ladle of pancake mixture on to the pan and swirl your pan around to even the pancake mixture out.
Let the pancake cook on one side for about a min or two then turn it over and place the cooked pancake on the plate. Continue doing it until finish all the pancake batter.
On another plate, take one pancake at a time and spread about 1 tbsp of Nutella all over the pancake, roll it into roll and sprinkle some icing on top before serve.

title: Simple Velouté Sauce
story: A simple velouté sauce is a great skill to learn as it can be used either as it is, or as the basis of other sauces or dishes. Although it sounds fancy, a simple velouté is just a white sauce similar to a béchamel sauce but made with stock rather than milk. You can make a velouté sauce with fish, beef or chicken stock, we will demonstrate a chicken stock here. If you try this recipe please remember to share your Cooksnap photo comment below and let us know how you got on, and any variations you made.

steps.description: Put your stock in a saucepan and gently warm it up, while this is warming, start your roux.
Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Add your flour and stir it in to form a roux (a roux is a paste made from butter and flour).

Start adding your warmed stock to the roux and stir continuously to prevent lumps from forming. Use a balloon whisk if you have one, or a wooden spatula if not. Keep adding all of your stock until you have a thin, smooth sauce. Now simmer the sauce gently (hot enough for small bubbles to come to the surface of the sauce, but not hot enough to boil it), for 30 minutes.

Now season to taste with salt and white pepper. If the sauce seems lumpy you can sieve or strain it to make it smoother. The velouté is now ready to use either as it is, or you could add, for example, mushrooms and serve it with roasted meats.

title: Simple White Sauce (Béchamel Sauce)
story:
This is a recipe for a simple white sauce (also called a Béchamel sauce)made using a roux. This simple white sauce can be used as it is in dishes such as lasagne, or you can add cheese (as shown in this recipe) to make dishes such as macaroni cheese. You could also add herbs such as parsley to this basic white sauce to make a parsley slice to serve with roast gammon or fish. 

Essential equipment - saucepan, wooden spoon or spatula

steps.description: Melt the butter in your saucepan.
Add the flour and stir over a medium heat for 2-3 minutes.

Start to add your milk a little at a time, stirring continually to keep the sauce smooth. If you stop stirring the sauce will become lumpy. If this happens remove the pan from the heat and whisk the sauce vigorously to remove the lumps, then continue adding your milk over a low heat.

When all of the milk is added, bring the sauce up to the boil, still stirring continuously. Once it has boiled and thickened, add more milk if it’s too thick. Season with salt and pepper. Stop here for a basic white sauce.

To make the cheese sauce, add your cheese at this point and stir over a low heat until the cheese is melted. Don’t re-boil the sauce or it will become stringy. Add nutmeg to taste if you like, the sauce is now ready.

title: Baked fish with tahini sauce - tagine samak bi tahini
story: White fish fillets are baked in the oven then coated with a mixture of tahini sauce called tarator, fried onions and pine nuts. Serve cold. A rare experience in savoring a cold fish dish!
ingredients: 1 kg fish fillets, such as Hamour fish

steps.description: Cut a piece of aluminum foil big enough to wrap the fish. Coat it with 2 tablespoons olive oil and put the fish fillets on it.
Spread the lemon slices over the fillets then pour over the lemon juice and the rest of the olive oil. Add some salt.
Wrap the aluminum foil around the fillets and put it in an oven tray.
Cook the fish fillets, in a preheated oven for 10 min. Then turn them on the other side and let them cook for another 10 min.
Remove tray from oven and let it cool.

To prepare the tahini sauce, dissolve the tahini paste in 3/4 cup of water so it does not clot when adding the rest of the ingredients. Add the crushed garlic, lemon juice and salt. Mix well till you get a fluid homogenous sauce.
In a pan, heat the vegetable oil and fry the sliced onions until they become tender. Remove the pan from heat.

Cut the fish fillets into large pieces and put them in a serving dish. Pour the tahini sauce over the fish and top with the fried onions and roasted pine nuts. Serve at room temperature or cold with pita bread.

Note: For an easier Tagine recipe, you can replace the fish with 3 tuna cans. In this case, drain the tuna and transfer it into the serving dish. Pour the tahini sauce over and top with the fried onions and pine nuts.
Note: You can find the recipe 'Tahini sauce' under my profile

title: Grilled meat cubes on skewers - lahem meshwi
story: Grilled meat cubes marinated in a mixture of cinnamon, vinegar, olive oil and black pepper. Grill on skewers. A must try at barbecue parties!
ingredients: 1 kg beef or veal, cut in cubes
12 small onions, peeled and cut in halves

steps.description: In a bowl, mix all the marinade ingredients together.
Add in the meat cubes and let them marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hr.
In each skewer, insert 5 meat cubes and 1 onion. Grill on both sides.

title: Half-moon shaped meat turnovers - sambousek bi lahmeh
story: Half-moon shaped small pies that are filled with a mixture of ground meat and onions then deep fried. They come out all crunchy and warm. A perfect appetizer!
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon dried yeast dissolved in 2 tablespoons of warm water

steps.description: To prepare the dough: mix all the ingredients together, except the water. Gradually pour in the warm water while kneading the ingredients until the dough becomes firm. If needed, add more water. Leave to rest until the filling is ready.

To prepare the filling: heat the vegetable oil in a pan. Add the ground beef, onions and pine nuts and season with salt and black pepper. Stir from time to time until the meat changes in color then remove from heat. Add the chopped parsley to the meat mixture, and the filling is ready.
On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough using a rolling pin. Cut the dough into 8 cm diameter circles using a circular pastry cutter.

Top each circle with 2 teaspoons of filling, fold in half to cover the stuffing and press edges together to seal. Crimp the edges with your fingers by making tight overlapping folds to give the sambousek its traditional shape.
In a saucepan, heat the 4 cups vegetable oil and deep fry the sambousek in batches until golden from both sides.
Remove and drain on a kitchen absorbent paper.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

title: Easy Stir Fry Sweet Chilli Sauce
story: Stir fry’s are a great meal to master as they are quick, easy and healthy. Here is another super simple stir fry sauce devised by Yui, to help you make a delicious and quick stir fry sauce from scratch. Our example is with stir fry vegetables but you could also add chicken, prawns, tofu, noodles or rice.

steps.description: Mix all of your sauce ingredients together in a bowl until combined.
In a small amount of oil, stir-fry until the vegetables are just cooked through. When the vegetables are tender with a bit of bite still, add your sauce.
Continue to stir fry for a few minutes, making sure all of the vegetables are coated in the sauce, before serving. you could garnish with fresh coriander and chilli before serving if you’d like to.

title: Kafta
story: Kafta is made of ground meat mixed with chopped parsley and onions. It is traditionally shaped in small patties or finger-shaped and pan fried. Enjoy with fried potatoes!
ingredients: 1 kg finely ground beef or lamb

steps.description: Put all the ingredients together in a bowl, except the vegetable oil. Knead well until ingredients are well mixed.
Place the kafta mixture in a food processor. Blend until well combined.
Divide the kafta into balls the size of a golf ball. With your hands flatten each ball to get a kafta patty.
In a deep skillet, heat the vegetable oil and fry the kafta patties until they turn brown on both sides.
Serve hot along with fried potatoes and a salad.

title: Easy Honey & Soy Stir Fry Sauce
story: Stir fries are a brilliant meal to have in your cooking repertoire. They make a healthy and quick midweek meal and you can make them as fancy or as elaborate as you like. Here is a super simple stir fry sauce (devised by Yui) that you can put together in a few minutes using kitchen basic ingredients. You can serve it with beef, tofu, noodles, mushrooms, vegetables or anything else that you fancy. If you try the recipe, don’t forget to share your Cooksnap photo comment with us.
ingredients: Mushrooms and ready to wok noodles

steps.description: To make the sauce, gather all of your ingredients together, measure them out and simply mix them together in a bowl. That’s it! Your stir fry sauce is ready to use!
Now gather together your vegetables/noodles/rice or whatever else you’d like to use in your stir fry.

Heat some sesame oil in a wok or large frying pan and start by stir frying your mushrooms. When they are cooked through, add your noodles. Stir fry on a high heat for a few minutes then add your sauce.
Stir well for a few more minutes until the sauce becomes glossy and thick. Then serve, add some fresh coriander and a lime wedge if you like to brighten up your final photo 😊

title: Classic Pesto Pasta
story:
This recipe is for a very simple fresh pesto that you can serve with pasta for a delicious homemade meal. Made using fragrant fresh basil, Parmesan and pine nuts, vegan option also available. 

Essential equipment - blender (ideal) or a pestle and mortar, sharp knife.

Optional equipment - garlic press, chopping board, spatula
ingredients: 50 g grated Parmesan cheese (or vegan alternative)
80 g (or a large handful) fresh basil

steps.description: Prepare your ingredients before starting, begin by gathering everything you need.
Remove the skin of your garlic cloves, and crush with a garlic press. Chop the garlic finely with a knife if you don’t have a press. Add the chopped garlic to your food processor.
Remove the thick stems from your basil and discard, place the washed leaves into the food processor. Add the pine nuts, 100 mls of the oil and the parmesan too.
Blend the mixture, you may need to scrape down the sides of the blender several times to get all of the ingredients incorporated fully. If it’s too thick, add more olive oil.

That’s it! Set your sauce to one side while you cook your pasta according the pasta manufacturers instructions. Then mix the spaghetti with a couple of tbsp of pesto. Top with a few more pine nuts and serve.

title: Easy Tomato Sauce for Pasta
story:
This is an easy tomato sauce recipe for pasta, aimed at complete beginners with a full method and photographic steps. Once the basic sauce has been mastered, you can add additional ingredients such as mushrooms, spices etc. It can also be used as the sauce for other dishes such as Bolognese and lasagne. Can be served rustic as it is, or puréed for a smoother sauce more reminiscent of jarred sauces (smoother sauces are often more popular with children). 

Essential equipment - chopping board, sharp knife, saucepan, spatula

Desirable equipment - garlic press

steps.description: Prepare all of your ingredients before starting.

Cut the pointy end off the onion leaving the roots at the other end intact. Peel off the outer brown layers. Cut the onion in half through the roots. Lay the onion flat on the chopping board, slice in strips towards the roots but without going through the roots. Then turn it round and slice again across rather first cuts to create chopped onion.
If you have a garlic press, use this to crush the peeled garlic cloves. If you don’t have a press, use your knife to finely dice the garlic.

Place your saucepan over a low heat. Add the oil, then the onions. Stir then turn your heat up slightly. You want the hob to be hot enough to cook the onions, but not so hot that you end up browning the onions. In a sauce like this, browned onions can make the sauce bitter.
After about 5 minutes the onions should be starting to soften up and will look a little translucent. Now add your tomato purée and garlic and stir well. Keep cooking for a few minutes.

Now add your tinned tomatoes and oregano. Stir well then let the pan sit, partly covered by the pan lid, over a low to medium heat to simmer. simmering means that the sauce isn’t boiling, but it’s just hot enough for little bubbles to rise to the surface and you can hear it bubbling gently.

Simmer for 20 mins then check the onions are nice and soft. If they are it’s done. Remove from the heat and allow to cool completely. You can blend at this stage if you want a smooth sauce. Store in the fridge for a week, or in the freezer for up to 2 months.

title: Basic 3 Egg Omelette Recipe
story:
This is a recipe for a basic 3 egg omelette. Aimed at beginner cooks, this recipe contains full step by step instructions and method photos. We have shown you how to make a cheese omelette here, but you can add whatever fillings you wish once you have mastered the basic technique. Don’t forget to share your Cooksnap/photo comment below. 

Essential equipment - non-stick frying pan, spatula, small bowl or jug, fork

steps.description: Set your ingredients and equipment out ready by the hob before you start cooking.

Place your frying pan on the hob over the lowest heat setting. Then add your eggs to the bowl or jug, add a pinch of salt and pepper and use your fork to whisk the eggs together until it becomes all one light yellow colour and has little air bubbles on the surface.

Place your butter in the pan and allow it to melt. If it sizzles wildly your pan is too hot. Remove the pan from the heat for a minute to let it cool down. Use your spatula to spread the butter over the base of the pan.

Now gently pour your beaten eggs into the pan. Swirl the pan so that the eggs cover the base. Then the heat of the hob up very slightly now to a low-medium. Use your spatula to scrape a line down through the middle of the omelette.
When the base starts to set, this action will draw a channel in the egg. Now tip your pan away from you to allow runny raw egg from the top of the omelette to run into the channel you have created.
Repeat this action several times until you have almost no runny egg on your omelette surface. If you lie, you can now fold your omelette, allow it to cook for another few minutes then serve.

Alternatively, you can add your filling here, we’ve used cheese in the example below. Sprinkle a small amount of cheddar on the surface, then gently use your spatula to fold the omelette in half. Allow it another few minutes on the heat before serving.

title: Easy Scrambled Eggs Recipe for Beginners
story:
This is an easy scrambled egg recipe for complete beginners. As such, we will take you through the recipe step by step with a full photo method. Then you can practice the recipe for yourself and share a photo comment/Cooksnap below.

Essential ingredients - non stick frying pan or small saucepan, spatula (wooden is ideal), bowl or measuring jug, fork, hob
ingredients: Optional spring onions or chives to garnish

steps.description: Set your ingredients and equipment out by your hob ready before you begin cooking.

Place your pan over a low heat on your hob. Then add your eggs to the bowl or jug, add salt and pepper to taste (a pinch of each is sufficient, remember you can always add more later but you can’t take it back out). Use your fork to whisk the eggs together until it becomes all one light yellow colour and has little air bubbles on the top.

Place your butter in your pan. It should slowly melt but not sizzle wildly, if it does remove your pan from the heat so the butter doesn’t burn. Allow the pan to cool slightly then put it back on the heat. Use your spatula to spread the butter around the pan.

When the butter is melted and slightly foamy, add your eggs to the pan. Stir immediately, but slowly and gently. You’ll see the egg start to cook on the bottom and as you stir, they form clumps of cooked egg. Keep going over a low heat until your eggs are opaque - raw egg white is translucent.
Some people like their eggs just done, that stage is shown below. However you can keep cooking them until you are happy with the texture and consistency.
Try not to over cook the eggs so they go rubbery. When done, gently remove the egg with your spatula to a serving plate. You can top with some finely chopped spring onions or herbs if you’d like to.

Now it’s your turn! Try the recipe for yourself and send us your photo comment/Cooksnap below. Once you’ve mastered the technique you can try adding cream or perhaps finely grated cheese to your raw eggs.

title: How to Cook a Perfect Fried Egg
story:
This easy fried egg recipe is for complete beginners and as such takes you through the method step by step with full photo instructions. Practice makes perfect so don’t forget to try the recipe for yourself, especially if you are learning to cook. Then share your Cooksnap/photo comment with us below. You can also ask us questions on the recipe and our Cookpad community team, will respond to you as quickly as possible. 

Essential equipment required - non-stick frying pan, spatula, hob, knife, pan lid or plate to fit your frying pan

Optional equipment - small bowl or mug
ingredients: 1 tsp cooking oil (eg. vegetable, coconut, olive)

steps.description: Get all of your equipment and ingredients ready by the side of your hob. Place the frying pan on the hob on a low heat.
As the frying pan is gently warming, add a teaspoon of oil to the frying pan. Take your spatula and use the spatula to spread the oil around your pan as shown in the photos.

Now take your egg in one hand and use your knife to crack it along one side. Aim for medium strength, you want to crack the egg but not crush it into your hand. If you are used to cracking eggs you can crack it straight into your pan. If not, crack your egg into a small bowl or mug first. This will give you more control and allow you to remove any rogue egg shell.

Tip your egg into the pan. The pan is still on a low heat at this point. It should immediately start to cook. If it sizzles loudly and starts to bubble then your pan is a bit too hot. Now turn your hob up to a medium heat and put your pan lid on the pan.

Your egg will now take between 1 and 3 minutes to cook through. Check it after each minute to see how it’s getting on. The lid helps to set the top of the egg, avoiding that unpleasant jelly egg white on the top with over cooked egg underneath. A runny, sunny-side up egg is done when the white is just set.

You can now season with salt and pepper if you like. You can also keep cooking it until the egg yolk is set through, or flip the egg over with your spatula to cook it through on both sides. When you’re ready, gently lift the egg out with your spatula and place on a plate or on top of toast.
Now it’s your turn. Don’t forget to share your Cooksnap/photo comment with us below!
